definition: ἑταιρηΐη, ἑταιρήϊος, η, ον, Ion. for ἑταιρεία, ἑταιρεῖος, α, ον.

children.definition: unchastity, Aeschin. 1.13, D. 22.21, Ph. 2.381, etc.
the festival of Ζεὺς ἑταιρεῖος at Magnesia, Hegesand. 25.

definition: ἑταιρίδιον, Dim. of ἑταίρα, Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.14 (pl.), Plu. Praec. 2.808e, Hld. 7.10.

children.definition: to be ἑταῖρος or comrade to any one, c. dat., ἀνδρὶ ἑταιρίσσαι Il. 24.335 ; of the Graces, h.Ven. 96.
Med., associate with oneself, choose for oneʼs comrade, ἤ τινά που Τρώων ἑταρίσσαιτο Il. 13.456, cf. Call. Dian. 206, Naumach. ap. Stob. 4.23.7.

children.label: b
children.definition: win over, App. Hann. 32, BC 3.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be a courtesan, in Act., Luc. DMeretr. 7.3 ; of a man, Sch. Ar. Th. 261:— Med., Ath. 13.593b, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).169.
associate with ἑταῖραι, Com.Adesp. 1012.
of or befitting a companion : ἡ ἑταιρική companionship, Arist. EN 1157b23 ; in full, ἑ. φιλία ib. 1161b12. Adv. -κῶς, προσφέρεσθαι Id. EE 1243a5.
τὸ ἑταιρικόν,=ἑταιρεία I.2, Th. 8.48 ; ἑ. συνάγειν Hyp. Eux. 8 ; τὰ ἑταιρικά factions, clubs, Plu. Lys. 5, D.C. 37.57 ; = Lat. collegia, Id. 38.13.

children.label: b
children.definition: ties of party, opp. τὸ ξυγγενές, Th. 3.82.
ἵππος -κή horse- guards of the Macedonian kings, Plb. 16.18.7, D.S. 17.37, Arr. An. 3.16.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: of or like a ἑταίρα, meretricious, γυνή Plu. Coniug. 2.140c, etc.; τὸ ἑ. the custom of ἑταῖραι, Alciphr. 2.1 ; concerning ἑταῖραι, λόγοι D.H. Lys. 3 : so Adv. -κῶς meretriciously, κεκοσμημένοι Zeno Stoic. 1.58, Luc. Bis Acc. 20, Plu. Pomp. 2.
ἑ. (sc. τέλος), τό, tax on courtesans, Ostr. 83 (ii B. C.); τελώνης ἑταιρεικοῦ (sic) Ἀφροδίτῃ Arch.Pap. 6.219 ( Elephantine, ii B. C.).
v.l. in X. HG 5.4.6, cf. Ph. 1.40, AP 6.208 ( Antip. Thess.); περὶ τῶν Ἀθήνησι Ἑ., title of several works, Ath. 13.567a:—not good Att., acc. to Thom.Mag. p.129R.
PGrenf. 2.41 ( i A. D., pl.).
harlotry, Clearch. 6, OGI 674.17 ( Egypt, i A. D.).
lewd man, Poll. 6.188:— fem. ἑταιρ-ίστρια, [LSJ Supp.] = lesbian , Pl. Smp. 191e, Luc. DMeretr. 5.2, Tim. Lex.
make friends, Sch. Il. 12.310.

definition: ἑταῖρος, Ep. and Dor. also ἕτᾰρος, Cleobul. ap. D.L. 1.93, A. Pers. 988 (lyr.), ὁ:—

children.definition: comrade, companion, in Hom. esp. of the followers of a chief, comrades-in-arms, Il. 1.179, al.; messmate, 17.577 ; fellow-slave, Od. 14.407, al.: joined with ἀνήρ, 8.584, Hdt. 5.95, Antipho 1.18 ; later, as a term of address, φίλʼ ἑταῖρε Thgn. 753, cf. Pl. Grg. 482a ; ὦταῖρε Scol. ap. Ar. V. 1238, cf. Ev.Matt. 20.13, al.: c. gen., δᾳιτὸς ἑταῖρε partner of my feast, h.Merc. 436 ; νυκτὸς ἑ. ib. 290 ; πόσιος καὶ βρώσιος ἑταῖροι mess mates, Thgn. 115 ; ἑ. ἐν πρήγματι Id. 116.
ἐσθλὸς ἑταῖρος, of a fair wind, Od. 11.7, 12.149 ; φθόνος κενεοφρόνων ἑ. Pi. Fr. 212 ; γέλως ἑ. ὕβρεων Plu. QConv. 2.622b : c. dat., βίον..τὸν σοφοῖς ἕταρον AP 7.470 ( Mel.).
pupil, disciple, e.g. of Socrates, X. Mem. 2.8.1, al., cf. Arist. Pol. 1274a28 ; Λεύκιππος καὶ ὁ ἑ. αὐτοῦ Δημόκριτος Id. Metaph. 985b4 : pl., fellow-pupils, Poll. 4.45.

data.quote: Λεύκιππος καὶ ὁ ἑ. αὐτοῦ Δημόκριτος

children.definition: partisans (cf. ἑταιρεία I.2), Lys. 12.43, Th. 8.48 ; οἱ περὶ αὐτὸν ἑ. his club-mates, D. 21.20.
members of a religious guild, OGI 573.1 (Cilicia, Jewish).
lovers, Semon. 7.49, Ar. Ec. 912 (lyr.).

ἑταῖροι, οἱ, the guards, i.e. the cavalry of the Macedonian kings, Theopomp.Hist. 217, Anaximen.Lamps. ap. Harp. s.v. πεζέταιρος, Arr. An. 3.16.11, etc.; to be distinguished from the kingʼs immediate retinue (cf. supr. I), Theopomp. l.c., Arr. An. 2.12.6, al.; of the Comites of the Roman Emperor, Βαρβίλλῳ τῷ ἐμῷ ἑτέρῳ (sic) PLond. 1912.105 (Epist. Claudii), cf. SIG 798.6 ( Cyzicus, i A. D., pl.).

Adj., associate of, τὸ ἐπιθυμητικὸν ἡδονῶν ἑ. Pl. R. 439d : Sup., τοῖς σεαυτοῦ ἑταιροτάτοις your closest companions, Id. Grg. 487d, cf. Phd. 89e, D.Chr. 1.44 ; σαργῶν γένος πέτρῃσιν ἑ. constant to the rocks, Opp. H. 4.267 : abs., of animals, gregarious, Id. C. 2.325.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑταίρα, Ion. ἑταίρη, Ep. ἑτάρη [ᾰ], ἡ, companion, Ἔρις..Ἄρεος..κασιγνήτη ἑτάρη τε Il. 4.441 ; Λάτω καὶ Νιόβα μάλα μὲν φίλαι ἦσαν ἔ. Sapph. 31, cf. 11 ; φύζα, φόβου κρυόεντος ἑ. Il. 9.2 ; φόρμιγξ.. ἣν ἄρα δαιτὶ θεοὶ ποίησαν ἑ. Od. 17.271, cf. h.Merc. 478 ; Νίκην, ἣ χορικῶν ἐστιν ἑ. Ar. Eq. 589 ; μιμητικὴ..τῷ ἐν ἡμῖν ἑ. καὶ φίλη ἐστί Pl. R. 603b ; Ποσειδάωνος ἑ., of a submerged city, Call. Del. 101.

data.quote: Λάτω καὶ Νιόβα μάλα μὲν φίλαι ἦσαν ἔ.
φόρμιγξ.. ἣν ἄρα δαιτὶ θεοὶ ποίησαν ἑ.
μιμητικὴ..τῷ ἐν ἡμῖν ἑ. καὶ φίλη ἐστί

children.definition: courtesan, Hdt. 2.134, Ar. Pl. 149, Ath. 13.567a, 571d, etc.; opp. πόρνη (a common prostitute), Anaxil. 22.1 ; opp. γαμετή, Philetaer. 5 ; Ἀφροδίτη ἑ. Apollod.Hist. 17.
friendly, a friend, AP 12.247 ( Strat.).
contubernium, Gloss.
keeping mistresses, Man. 4.313, Jul. Gal. 238e.
yearling, Schwyzer 644.18 ( Aegae, iv/iii B. C.); also ἔτελον, ib. 252.11 ( Cos, iii B. C.).

definition: ἐτανόν ἀληθῶς, σφόδρα, Hsch.; cf. ἐτεός.

children.definition: ἐτανός yearly, coined by Tz. ad Hes. Op. 31.

definition: ἕταρος, ἑτάρη, v. ἑταῖρος I and ΙΙ. ἔτας, v. ἔτης.

children.definition: trial, affliction, LXX Jb. 10.17.
ἐξεταστής, CIG (add.) 3641b42 ( Lampsacus), Suid. s.v. δοκιμαστῆρες.

definition: ἐταυτῶς ἀληθῶς, Hsch. ἐτέα, ἡ, prob.,

children.definition: Theognost. Can. 7. ἐτεῇ, v. ἐτεός.

definition: ἔτειος, α, ον ( ος, ον E. Fr. 330 (s.v.l.)), ( ἔτος)

children.definition: yearly, annual, ἄεθλα Pi. I. 4(3).67 ; δασμός E. Rh. 435 ; of the year, ὧραι Thphr. Od. 68 ; μεταλλαγαί E. Fr. 330 (prob.) ; ἐτεία, ἡ, yearly board of officials or the term of such a board, SIG 559.45 ( Magn. Mae., iii B. C., but Arc.): neut. pl. ἔτεια, as Adv., Lyc. 721.
lasting a year, φρουρά A. Ag. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: of one year, yearling, X. Cyn. 5.14 ; βρέφος Poll. 2.8.

definition: ἔτελις, ὁ, a fish, Arist. HA 567a20. ἔτελον, v. ἔταλον.

children.definition: a genuine son of Butes, one of the family which supplied the hereditary priests of Athena Polias, Alex. 201, D. 21.182, cf. Harp.
honest slave: καί κʼ ἐτεοδμώων read by Ptol. Ascai. for καί κέ τεο δμώων in Od. 16.305.
true Cretans, Od. 19.176, POxy. 1241 v 27.
genuine, good barley, Thphr. CP 3.22.2.

definition: ἐτεός, ά, όν (not found in masc.),

children.definition: true, genuine, πόλλʼ ἐτεά Il. 20.255; ἢ ἐτεὸν Κάλχας μαντεύεται 2.300; εἰ ἐτεόν περ whether it be true indeed, 14.125; εἰ δή ῥʼ ἐ. γε καὶ ἀτρεκέως ἀγορεύεις 15.53.

data.quote: εἰ δή ῥʼ ἐ. γε καὶ ἀτρεκέως ἀγορεύεις

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐτεόν, as Adv., in truth, verily, εἰπέ μοι εἰ ἐ. γε φίλην ἐς πατρίδʼ ἱκάνω Od. 13.328, cf. Il. 8.423; εἰ ἐ. . . μιμνῄσκομαι rightly, Theoc. 25.173.

data.quote: εἰπέ μοι εἰ ἐ. γε φίλην ἐς πατρίδʼ ἱκάνω

children.definition: Ar. (not in other Com.) interrog., really, indeed, οὐκ ἀκούσεσθʼ ἐ. . . ; Ach. 322, cf. 609; ἐ. ἡγεῖ γὰρ θεούς; Eq. 32, cf. 733; in asking for information, τί οὖν τοῦτʼ ἐστὶν ἐ.; Nu. 93, cf. V. 8; τί δὲ τοῦτʼ ἐγέλασας ἐ.; Nu. 820; cf. ἐτός (B).
ἐτεή, ἡ, reality, [ἄνθρωπος] ἐτεῆς ἀπήλλακται Democr. 6; dat. ἐτεῇ, as Adv., in reality, νόμῳ γλυκύ, νόμῳ πικρόν, ἐτεῇ δʼ ἄτομα καὶ κενόν Id. 125; ἐ. οὐδὲν ἴσμεν Id. 7.

data.quote: νόμῳ γλυκύ, νόμῳ πικρόν, ἐτεῇ δʼ ἄτομα καὶ κενόν

children.definition: varying fortune of battle, coined by Eust. 662.46.
to be conquered, Sch. Il. 15.738.

giving strength to the other side, μάχης ἑτεραλκέα νίκην victory in battle inclining to the other side, Il. 16.362; σῆμα τιθεὶς Τρώεσσι, μ. ἑ. ν. a sign that victory was changing sides, 8.171; ἵνα δὴ Δαναοῖσι μ. ἑ. ν. δῷς inclining to their side, 7.26; without μάχης, δίδου ἑτεραλκέα νίκην 17.627, Od. 22.236; Ἄρης ἑ. A. Pers. 952 (lyr.): in late Prose, ἑ. νίκη Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 8, Ael. Fr. 135.
Act., ἑ. δῆμος a body of men which decides the victory, Il. 15.738; λύσις ἑ. κήδευς Nic. Th. 2; ποδῶν ἑ. ταρσῷ, of a lame man, Nonn. D. 9.230.

children.label: II
children.definition: inclining first to one side then to the other, doubtful, μάχη Hdt. 9.103; μόθου ἑ. κλωγμῷ Orac. ap. Luc. JTr. 31. Ion. Adv. - αλκέως, ἀγωνίζεσθαι with varying fortune, Hdt. 8.11.
of different number: τὸ ἑ. change of number, as a figure of speech, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
Phryn. PS p.68 B.
to suffer in half the brain, to be half-mad, crazy, Ar. Fr. 778.
illusory, ἄλην ἑ. λεύσσων Nic. Al. 84.
on alternate days, day and day about, ζώουσʼ ἑτερήμεροι, of the Dioscuri, Od. 11.303, cf. Ph. 2.189, Jul. Or. 4.147a; ἑ. ὁ βίος τῶν ἀσκητῶν Ph. 1.643; of an intermittent fever, Orph. L. 633.

definition: ἑτέρηφι, Ep. dat. fem. of ἕτερος.

children.definition: weighing down to one side, Hsch., Suid. s.v. κατὰ πρόσκλισιν.
weighing down one side, Eust. 1316.26.
second marriage, Tz.ad Lyc. 1317.
by another mother, opp. ὁμογάστριος, Tz.ad Hes. Op. 374.
differ in kind, Nicom. Ar. 1.10.
of different kinds, τὰ ἑ. Arist. Cat. 1b16; of animals, Id. HA 601a25; ἑ. ζῷα Ph. 2.370; ᾠά Gp. 14.7.28; ἐξ ἑτερογενῶν σωμάτων ὑπάρξαι, of Centaurs, D.S. 4.8; μόρια, i.e. not paired, Gal. UP 16.14.

of different kind or race, Demetr.Lac. 1012.36 F., D.T. 635.7; [ἑτερότης] ἑ. καὶ ἀλλόφυλος πρὸς αὐτήν Dam. Pr. 308; simply, different, πράξεις D.S. 1.9. Adv. - νῶς, διαφέρειν ἀλλήλων S.E.M. 7.361, cf. Nicom. Ar. 1.10.
of diverse materials, of a garment, Sm. De. 22.11: generally, complex, opp. ὁμογενής, Demetr. Lac.1429.2 F.

children.label: II
children.definition: of different gender, A.D. Conj. 243.1 (s.v.l.); - γενές, τό, change of gender in a constructio ad sensum, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
with one eye grey, Arist. GA 779b4.
of other ( i.e. foreign) tongue, Plb. 23.13.2, Str. 8.1.2; ἐν ἑτερογλώσσοις λαλεῖν by men of foreign tongue, 1 Ep.Cor. 14.21, cf. Onos. 26.2, Aq. Is. 33.19.
of diverse tongues, ζῷα Ph. 1.406.
with one side of the mouth harder than the other, [ ἵπποι] X. Eq. 1.9, al.; glossed by ἀπειθής, ἢ ἄπληστος, Phot.
Hdn.Gr. 1.83.
difference of opinion, J. AJ 10.11.7, Hsch. s.v. διχόνοια.
Vett.Val. 79.18; τὰ ἐς θεὸν -γνώμονες Agath. 4.2, cf. 3.12.
Hippiatr. 11, Hsch. s.v. ἀμφίσγονοι.
taught by another, opp. αὐτοφυής, Olymp. in Alc. p.11 C.
teach differently, teach false doctrine, 1 Ep. Ti. 1.3.
hold an erroneous opinion, Pl. Tht. 190e; differ in opinion, περί τινος Ph. 1.508.
a taking one thing for another, error of opinion, Pl. Tht. 193d.
difference of opinion, Ph. Fr. 72 H. (pl.).
differing in opinion, Luc. Eun. 2.

holding opinions other than the right, heterodox, Ph. 1.403, al., Arr. Epict. 2.9.19, J. BJ 2.8.5; [ ἰατρός] Sor. 1.52, cf. Gal. 9.670. Adv. - ξως in heterodox manner, τῆς μουσικῆς ἀκροᾶσθαι Philostr. VS 2.1.11.
shifting of strength, Sch. Il. 7.26.
of different power or faculty, Porph. Sent. 33 (prob.l.).
of another tribe, foreign, Str. 8.1.2, Ph. 2.400.
numerical diversity, Theol.Ar. 8.
of another kind, Arist. HA 508b11, f.l. in Placit. 2.30.5; of diverse kinds, Ph. Fr. 29 H.
having the form of diversity, Dam. Pr. 303; opp. ταυτοειδής, ib. 340. Adv. - δῶς ib. 55.
zealous for one side. Adv. - λως unfairly, Hes. Th. 544.

children.label: II
children.definition: zealous in another pursuit, AP 11.216 ( Lucill.).
of different tastes, S.E.M. 7.56.
draw unequally, Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἰσοφόροι: c. dat., ἑ. ἀπίστοις to be yoked in unequal partnership with unbelievers, 2 Ep.Cor. 6.14.
inclination to one side, of the balance, Sch. Luc. Lex. 3.
unevenly yoked, of animals of diverse kind, LXX Le. 19.19, cf. Ph. 2.369; of vases, not pairs, PCair.Zen. 38.12 (iii B.C.).
leaning to one side, Ps.-Phoc. 15.

children.label: II
children.definition: yoked with another, i.e. double, Nonn. D. 10.348.

children.label: III
children.definition: differently formed, A.D. Adv. 171.17. Adv. - γως in a different declension, Hdn.Gr. ap. Eust. 113.35; also τὰ ὁ. λεγόμενα (e.g. σπουδαῖος, as Adj. of ἀρετή) Procl. in Cra. p.40 P.
yoked singly, without its yokefellow, metaph., μήτε τὴν πόλιν ἑτερόζυγα περιιδεῖν γεγενημένην Cimon ap. Plu. Cim. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. II, Nonn. D. 5.148.
flourishing on one side: of children of the same father, but different mothers, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).110, Eust. 1283.2, Tz.ad Hes. Op. 374.
practising a false religion, interpol. in Suid. s.v. θρῆσκος.
speaking different tongues, Nonn. D. 36.426, al.
sounding different from before, ib. 9.256, al.
of twofold sounds, ἠχώ ib. 42.255.

definition: ἑτεροῖος, α, ον, Ep. ἑτερ-οίϊος, η, ον, D.P. 1180:—

children.definition: of a different kind, diverse, Hdt. 1.99, al.; τὰ ἑ. οὐκ ἀλλοῖα; Pl. Prm. 161a, al.; τί φαίνεται ἑτεροῖον διανοηθεὶς ὁ ἰητρὸς ἢ . . ; Hp. VM 7; ἑ. τινός ib. 9; unusual, strange, Id. Acut. 6; φωναί Phld. Po. 994 Fr. 10. Adv. - οίως, διαιτηθῆναι Hp. Acut. 39, cf. Gal. 2.219.

children.label: II
children.definition: diversified, differentiated, κόσμος, ἀριθμός, Dam. Pr. 194, 204.

children.label: III
children.definition: different from what should be, untoward, ἤν τι ἑ. ἀποβαίνῃ Luc. JTr. 32.
difference in kind, Pl. Prm. 160d, Ph. 1.5; ἡ ἑτερότης ἄρα ἑτεροιότης Dam. Pr. 440.

make of different kind, alter, Hp. Acut. 37, Plu. Vind. 2.559c; ἐς τοιήνδε ἕξιν τὸν ἄνθρωπον Aret. SD 2.1:— Pass., Hdt. 2.142, 7.225, Hp. VM 14, Fract. 15, Ph. 2.93; τὸ -ούμενον τῆς πτώσεως A.D. Synt. 96.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be differentiated, Dam. Pr. 220.

alteration, Diog.Apoll. 5 (pl.); opp. φορά, Arist. Ph. 217b26, cf. Mu. 400a24 (pl.); ἀέρος Epicur. Ep. 2p.43U. (pl.); (sc. ψυχῆς) of sensation, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.23; τῆς οὐσίας, τοῦ τέλους, τοῦ περιέχοντος, Plu. Def.orac. 2.430c, A.D. Pron. 18.15, M.Ant. 4.39: Ἑτεροιούμενα, τά, mythological transformations, title of work by Nicander, Ant.Lib. 1, etc.
alterative, ἡ τερατολογουμένη -ωτική, of Chrysippus’ theory of sensation (cf. ἑτεροίωσις), Stoic. 1.108.
bearing different fruit, of grafts, Hp. Nat.Puer. 26.
motion externally caused, Procl. in Alc. p.225 C.
moved by external force, incapable of self-motion, opp. αὐτοκίνητος, Procl. Inst. 14, Simp. in Epict. p.10 D., Dam. Pr. 18, al., Syrian. in Metaph. 23.21. Adv. - τως Simp. in Epict. p.4 D.
lean on one side, Anon. Intr. Arat. p.98 M., Sm. Ps. 16 (17).11, Phryn. PS p.68 B.; cf. - κλονέω.

leaning to one side, uneven, Hp. Art. 24; of a building, D.C. 57.21; τὰ ἑ. τῶν χωρίων sloping ground, X. Cyn. 2.7. Adv. - νῶς one-sidedly, Sor. 2.62; ἑ. ἔχειν πρὸς ἡδονήν to have a propensity to it, Arr. Epict. 3.12.7.
irregularly inflected, of nouns, as γυνή, γυναικός, A.D. Synt. 102.12, etc.; of Verbs, as ἔσθω, ἔφαγον, Id. Pron. 13.2. Adv. - τως Eust. 113.41.
shake to one side, Opp. C. 4.204 ( v.l. - κλινέω).
exercise in which two parties are engaged, Cael.Aur. TP 5.11.133 ( hatero- codd.).

pain on one side of the head (cf. ἡμικρανία), Archig. ap. Gal. 8.94, Aret. CD 1.2, etc. (also ἑτερο-κράνιον, τό, Gal. 14.400). Adj. ἑτερο-κρᾱνικός, ή, όν, liable to such pain, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.19.1.
repeating sound, Ἠχώ Nonn. D. 39.347.
to be deaf of one ear, LXX Si. 19.27 (nisi leg. ἐθελο-).
deaf on one side, Cyrill. ap. Valck. Animadv. ad Ammon. p.65.
different, i.e. false, speech, Sm. Ps. 138(139).4.
woolly, shaggy on one side, Str. 5.1.12: also ἑτερο-μαλλής, ές, Hsch. s.v. καυνάκαι.
with only one hole for the arm, i.e. only coming over one shoulder, worn by slaves, opp. ἀμφιμάσχαλος, Poll. 7.47, Sch. Ar. Eq. 878.
increase on one side, Artem. 1.31.
inclination to one side, Suid., Phot. s.v. κατὰ πρόσκλισιν.
leaning to one side, one-sided, βίος Crito ap. Stob. 3.3.64. Adv. - ρῶς one-sidedly (i.e.not in equal proportions), Speus. ap. Theol.Ar. 61 (nisi leg. - ρεῖς).
τὸ ἑ. separation, Porph. ap. Stob. 1.49.25a.
difference of metre:
of different metre, both in Heph. Poëm. p.74C.
with sides of uneven length, i.e. oblong, X. Eq. 7.14; ἑτερόμηκες, τό, oblong rectangle, Arist. Cat. 11a10, de An. 413a17, Euc. 1 Def. 22.
not square, i.e. produced by the multiplication of two unequal factors, as 6 = 3 x 2, Pl. Tht. 148a, Plu. Isid. 2.367f; opp. ἰσόπλευρος (both of line and number), Arist. APo. 73b1.
of the sides of a rectangle, Iamb. in Nic. pp. 72,94P.
born of another mother, Sch. Lyc. 19 (ed. Bachm.).

definition: ἑτερομήτωρ, ορος, ὁ, ἡ, = foreg., Sch. A.R. 4.223.

children.definition: identity in diversity, Procl. Theol.Plat. 1.21.
in which only one of the two parties appears, Zen. 3.88, Eust. 999.63, Hsch. (- μυνος cod.). (Perh.rather to be connected with *μωλέω, as in Cret. ἀμφιμωλέω etc.)

of different or diverse form, Ael. NA 12.16, Ph. 1.655; opp. ἀνθρωποειδής, Ptol. Tetr. 145; so of monstrosities, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.47: hence ἑτερο-μορφία, ἡ, monstrosity, of the Minotaur, Isid. Etym. 11.3.9.
differing in substance, Porph. Sent. 35. Adv. - ίως ib. 37:—also in form ἑτερούσιος, ψυχὴν ἐν ἀλλοτρίῳ πράγματι καὶ ἑτερουσίῳ συνδεδεμένην ib. 32, cf. Iamb. Myst. 1.19.
counter-irritation, Dsc. 2.154.
of unequal thickness, ξύλα Apollod. Poliorc. 164.8.
wandering hither and thither, ὄθμα Nic. Al. 243.
with unequal sides, of beams, Apollod. Poliorc. 161.12:
vary in breadth, Hero *Mens. 59.
with two visible faces, λίθοι SIG 247 ii 70 ( Delph., iv B.C.); cf. ἁτερόπλευρος.

children.label: II
children.definition: with unequal sides, Scymn. 267.
irregularly combined, Diom. p.481 K.
lent on bottomry with the risk of the outward, but not of the homeward, voyage, ἀργύριον D. 34.30; δανείσαντες ἑ. τἀργύριον εἰς Ἀθήνας Id. 56.29; τὰ ἑ. (sc. ἀργύρια) Id. 34.8.
uneven, double flutes, Anacreont. 2B.4 (dub.l.).
go lame of one foot, Hippiatr. 109.
making different, lamb. Myst. 1.18; creating difference, Dam. Pr. 192, al.; δύναμις, opp. ταυτοποιός, Procl. in Cra. p.20 P.; ἡ κίνησις ἐκστατική ἐστι καὶ ἑ. Simp. in Epict. p.99 D.

data.quote: ἡ κίνησις ἐκστατική ἐστι καὶ ἑ.

children.definition: clasped on one side, of a womanʼs dress, Call. Fr. 225.
with uneven feet, halting, Alciphr. 3.27, Philostr. VS 1.21.1, Hippiatr. 13.
of another person: σχῆμα ἑ. when a statement is made in the words of another, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5, cf. Choerob. Rh. p.256S. Adv. - πως, ἀνατίθησι Proll.Hermog. in Rh. 7.7 W.
of another city, Erinn. 5; of various cities, λαός Nonn. D. 26.41.
having cases formed from different stems, e.g. μέγας, μεγάλου, A.D. Pron. 11.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: πτωτον, τό, change of case, as a figure of speech, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
leaning to one side, Poll. 8.14.
lean on one side, Plu. An.procr. 2.1026e.
making now one side and now another preponderate, Ζεύς A. Supp. 403 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: inclining to one side or the other, of patients in the crisis of a disease, Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 21.
one-sided, ἑ. ζήτημα where the weight of evidence preponderates, Hermog. Stat. 1.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. - πῶς v.l. in Poll. 8.13.

inclined to one side, ἡ κλῖμαξ ἑ. ἐπὶ γῆν ἀφίξεται will come down on one corner, unevenly, Hp. Art. 43; ἑ. ἐπάρματα swellings on one side, Id. Epid. 1.1; φλεγμοναί ibid.; τὰ ἑ., of crippled limbs, Id. Off. 23.
inclining to one side or the other, θεῶν ἑ. δῶρα gifts that may prove either good or evil, Rhian. 1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - πως Poll. 4.172, Gal. 8.430, Aspasia ap. Aët. 16.72.
of different rhythm: hence, of the pulse, having a false rhythm, i.e. unsuitable to the patientʼs age, Gal. 8.516, al.

definition: ἕτερος, α, ον, only Att.- Ion. with ἕ-, Dor. ἅτερος [ᾰ] IG 4.914.9 (Epid.), etc. (and Att. in crasis, v. infr.), Aeol. ἄτερος Alc. 41.5, etc.:— but ἅτερος [ᾱ], Att. crasis for ὁ ἅτερος, Com.Adesp. 14.23 D., al., Ion. οὕτερος (fr. ὁ ἕτ-) Hdt. 1.34, etc., Dor. ὥτερος Theoc. 7.36; neut. θάτερον A. Ag. 344, And. 2.7, etc., Ion. τοὔτερον Hdt. 1.32: pl. ἅτεροι, for οἱ ἅτεροι, Arist. Pol. 1255a20; θάτερα S. El. 345, Th. 1.87, etc.; gen. θατέρου S. Ph. 597, etc., Ion. τοὐτέρου Semon. 7.113, Dor. θατέρω Ti.Locr. 94a, θωτέρω Epich. 71 (dub. l.); dat. θατέρῳ A. Pr. 778; fem. nom. ἡτέρα IG 2(2).1498.76, 1615.14,87 (iv B.C.), S. OC 497, Ar. Lys. 85, 90 codd., Paus.Gr. Fr. 82; dat. θητέρᾳ S. OT 782, Tr. 272, E. Hipp. 894, Ar. Av. 1365, etc., cf. Paus.Gr. l.c. (in Mss. sts. θατέρᾳ), Ion. τἠτέρῃ Phoen. 5.2.—Later masc. and fem. θάτερος, θατέρα, even with the Art., Men. 846, Chrysipp. ap. Paus.Gr. Fr. 82, Lyc. 590, Polem. Cyn. 4, Luc. D Mort. 8[26].1 (condemned in Pseudol. 29), Gp. 14.20.2, etc.; τῶν θατέρων Iamb. in Nic. p.83 P.; θάτερον acc. sg. masc., E. Ion [849].

children.label: I
children.definition: one or the other of two, usu. c. Art. exc. in Poets ; freq. of natural pairs, σκαιῇ (sc. χειρὶ) ἔγχος ἔχων, ἑτέρηφι δὲ λάζετο πέτρον Il. 16.734; τῇ ἑτέρῃ μὲν . . τῇ δʼ ἑτέρῃ . . 14.272, cf. X. Cyn. 10.11; χειρὶ ἑτέρῃ with one hand, Il. 12.452, Od. 10.171 (but χεὶρ ἑτέρη commonly of the left hand, v. infr. IV.I); ἑτέροιο διὰ κροτάφοιο Il. 4.502; χωλὸς δʼ ἕτερον πόδα 2.217, cf. Ar. Ec. 162, Din. 1.82; ἀμφότεραι αἱ γνάθοι, ἢ ἡ ἑτέρα X. Eq. 1.9; ἐκκοπεὶς τὸν ἕ. τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν D.H. 5.23; εἰς γόνυ θάτερον Philostr. Im. 2.20; of pairs in general, Il. 5.258, etc.; τὴν ἑ. πύλην one of the two gates, Hdt. 3.156; ὁ ἕ. τῶν στρατηγῶν Th. 4.43; τὸ ἕ. τοῖν δυοῖν τειχοῖν Id. 7.24: freq. of alternatives presented, τῶνδε τὰ ἕ. ποιέειν Hdt. 4.126; ἑλοῦ γε θάτερʼ, ἢ . . ἢ . . S. El. 345; τοῖνδʼ ἑλοῦ δυοῖν πότμοιν τὸν ἕ. E. Ph. 952 ; δυοῖν ἀγαθοῖν τοῦ ἑτέρου τεύξεσθαι Th. 4.28; δυοῖν θάτερα, ἢ . . ἢ . . Pl. Tht. 187c; ὅταν δυοῖν καλοῖν θάτερον κάλλιον ᾖ, ἢ τῷ ἑτέρῳ τούτοιν ἢ ἀμφοτέροις ὑπερβάλλον κάλλιόν ἐστιν Id. Grg. 475a: in pl., one of two parties or sets, Od. 11.258; τῶν ἕτεροί γε παῖδα κλαύσονται one set of parents, either mine or thine, Il. 20.210; δώῃ δʼ ἑτέροισί γε νίκην 7.292; ἑτέροισι δὲ κῦδος ἔδωκαν 13.303: freq. with neg., οὐδʼ ἕτεροι 11.71.

data.quote: ἔγχος ἔχων, ἑτέρηφι δὲ λάζετο πέτρον
ἀμφότεραι αἱ γνάθοι, ἢ ἡ ἑτέρα
ὅταν δυοῖν καλοῖν θάτερον κάλλιον ᾖ, ἢ τῷ ἑτέρῳ τούτοιν ἢ ἀμφοτέροις ὑπερβάλλον κάλλιόν ἐστιν

children.definition: ἕτερος (in Prose always ὁ ἕτερος) is generally repeated; ἑ. μὲν δουρὶ . . , τῷ δʼ ἑ. 21.164; τὸν ἕ., ἕ. δὲ . . Od. 5.266; ἕ. λευκόν, ἑτέρην δὲ μέλαιναν Il. 3.103, etc.: but sts. omitted in one clause, [ ἕτερος μὲν] κακῶν, ἕ. δὲ ἐάων 24.528, cf. 7.420, IG 2(2).1388.46 (prob.), etc.; ἡ μὲν . . , ἡ δʼ ἑτέρη Il. 22.149, IG 1(2).76.50; ἕ. . . , ὁ δὲ . . Od. 8.374; answered by ἄλλος, ἕτερον μὲν κεύθῃ ἐνὶ φρεσίν, ἄλλο δὲ εἴπῃ Il. 9.313, cf. Od. 7.123; reversely ἄλλῳ ὀρχηστύν, ἑτέρῳ κίθαριν [ἔδωκε] Il. 13.731, cf. Pl. R. 439b, Tht. 184e; τότε μὲν ἕτερα . . , τότε δὲ ἄλλα . . Pl. Alc. 1.116e; ὁ ἕτερος . . , ὁ λοιπός . . X. An. 4.1.23 ; ἕτερα . . , τὰ δὲ . . S. OC 1454 (lyr.); later μίαν μὲν . . ἑτέραν δέ A.D. Synt. 172.5; τὴν μίαν . . τὴν δʼ ἑτέρην AP 9.680.

data.quote: ἕτερος μὲν] κακῶν, ἕ. δὲ ἐάων
ἄλλος, ἕτερον μὲν κεύθῃ ἐνὶ φρεσίν, ἄλλο δὲ εἴπῃ

children.definition: ἐξ ἑτέρων ἕτερʼ ἐστίν one building follows on another, Od. 17.266; <ἀ> δʼ ἀτέρα τὰν ἀτέραν κύλιξ ὠθήτω let one cup push on the other, Alc. 41.5; ἢ θάτερον δεῖ δυστυχεῖν ἢ θάτερον one party or the other, E. Ion [849]; ἕτεροι ἑτέρων ἠξίωσαν ἄρχειν Th. 2.64; ἕτερος ἀφʼ ἑτέρου θεραπείας ἀναπιμπλάμενοι ἔθνῃσκον ib. 51; εἴ τίς τι ἕτερος ἑτέρου προφέρει Id. 7.64; ξυμμειγνυμένων ἑτέρων ἑτέροις Ar. Av. 701; συμφορὰ ἑτέρα ἑτέρους πιέζει one calamity oppresses one, another others, E. Alc. 893 (lyr.); ἑτέρᾳ δʼ ἕτερος ἕτερον ὄλβῳ καὶ δυνάμει παρῆλθεν Id. Ba. 905, cf. S. OC 231 (anap.); ἄλλη δʼ εἰς ἑτέρην ὀλυφύρετο A.R. 1.250.

data.quote: εἴ τίς τι ἕτερος ἑτέρου προφέρει
ἑτέρᾳ δʼ ἕτερος ἕτερον ὄλβῳ καὶ δυνάμει παρῆλθεν

children.definition: second, ἡ μὲν . . , ἡ δʼ ἑτέρη . . , ἡ δὲ τρίτη . . Od. 10.352 sq., cf. Il. 16.179, al., X. Cyr. 2.3.22; ἡ ἑ. πρότασις the minor premiss, Arist. EN 1143b3: without Art., ἕ. τέρας Hdt. 7.57; προσαγορεύεις αὐτὰ ἑτέρῳ ὀνόματι you call them further by a new name, Pl. Phlb. 13a; cf. IV.1b.

children.label: b
children.definition: τόσσοι δʼ αὖθʼ ἕτεροι ποταμοί as many more, Hes. Th. 367; ἕτερον τοσοῦτον as much again, Hdt. 2.149; ἑτέρου τοσούτου χρόνου for as long again, Isoc. 4.153; ἕ. τοιαῦτα other things of like kind, Hdt. 1.120, 191; ἑτέρων τοιῶνδε (sc. ἀνθρώπων) ἄρχεις ib. 207; τῷ αὐτῷ τρόπῳ . . τῷ ἑτέρῳ in the same way over again, Id. 2.127; ἄλλα τε τοιαῦθʼ ἕτερα μυρία Ar. Fr. 333.4; χιλίας ἑτέρας [δραχμάς] D. 58.6; δεύτερον, τρίτον ἕ. δικαστήριον, Id. 23.71,74; ἕ. ἐγώ, of a friend, Pythag. ap. Iamb. in Nic. p.35 P.; ἕτεροι αὐτοί second selves, Arist. EN 1161b28; εὕρηκε τὸν ἕ., τὸν σέ Men. 474.

children.label: II
children.definition: another, of many, with a sense of difference, Il. 4.306, Od. 7.123, Ar. Ach. 422, Lys. 66, etc.; ἕ.αὖ τις Id. Eq. 949; ἕ. αὖ Id. Pax 295, etc.; ἕτερα ἄττα Pl. Tht. 188b; repeated ἑτέραν χἀτέραν τρικυμίαν Men. 536.8: with neg., οἷα οὐχ ἕτερα [ἐγένετο] such as none like them had happened, Th. 1.23; ναυμαχία . . οἵα οὐχ ἑτέρα τῶν προτέρων Id. 7.70; οὐδεμιᾶς ἥσσων μᾶλλον ἑτέρας ib. 29 (s.v.l.); οὐχ ἕτερον ἀλλά . . none other than, Plu. QConv. 2.671b, cf. UPZ 71.9 (ii B.C.).

data.quote: ναυμαχία . . οἵα οὐχ ἑτέρα τῶν προτέρων

children.label: b
children.definition: οἱ ἕ. the rest, Hdt. 4.169.

children.label: c
children.definition: ὁ ἑ. ‘oneʼs neighbour’, ἀγαπᾶν τὸν ἕ. Ep.Rom. 13.6, cf. Ep.Gal. 6.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: of another kind, different, ἕ. δέ με θυμὸς ἔρυκεν Od. 9.302; τὸ μὲν ἕ., τὸ δὲ ἕ., i.e. they are different, Pl. Men. 97d, cf. R. 346a; ἕ. τε καὶ ἀνόμοιον Id. Smp. 186b; τὸ δὲ ταὐτὸν ἕ. ἀποφαίνειν καὶ τὸ θάτερον ταὐτόν Id. Sph. 259d; ἕ. ἤδη ἦν καὶ οὐχ ὁ αὐτός D. 34.12; ἑτέραν ἔδωκεν παντὶ τῷ κόσμῳ ὄψιν OGI 458.7 (i B. C.); ἕ. εὐαγγέλιον Ep.Gal. 1.6: coupled with ἄλλος, χἀτέρους ἄλλους πόνους and other different toils, E. Supp. 573 (s.v.l.), cf. Or. 345 (dub.l.); Ῥόδον καὶ ἄλλας ἑτέρας πόλεις D. 15.27; ἕτερον τό τʼ ἀλγεῖν καὶ θεωρεῖν ἐστʼ ἴσως Philem. 75.7; ἕτερα φρονῶν καὶ δημηγορῶν Din. 1.17: c.gen., other than, different from, φίλους . . ἑτέρους τῶν νῦν ὄντων Th. 1.28, cf. Pl. Prt. 333a, D. 10.44, etc.; ἕτερον, ἕτερα ἢ . . , E. Or. 345, X. Cyr. 1.6.2; παρὰ ταῦτα πάντα ἕτερόν τι Pl. Phd. 74a ; ἕτερα πολιτείας εἴδη παρὰ μοναρχίαν Arist. Pol. 1294a25, cf. 1286b21.

data.quote: τὸ δὲ ταὐτὸν ἕ. ἀποφαίνειν καὶ τὸ θάτερον ταὐτόν
ἕ. ἤδη ἦν καὶ οὐχ ὁ αὐτός
ἑτέραν ἔδωκεν παντὶ τῷ κόσμῳ ὄψιν
ἕτερον τό τʼ ἀλγεῖν καὶ θεωρεῖν ἐστʼ ἴσως

children.definition: other than should be, euphem. for κακός, παθεῖν μὲν εὖ, παθεῖν δὲ θάτερα S. Ph. 503; ἀγάθʼ ἢ θάτερα, ἵνα μηδὲν εἴπω φλαῦρον D. 22.12: abs., δαίμων ἕ. Pi. P. 3.34; λέκτρα, συμφοραί, E. Med. 639 (lyr.), HF 1238; ἐὰν τὰ ἕ. ψηφίσωνται οἱ δικασταί D. 48.30; πλέον θάτερον ἐποίησαν did more harm (than good), Isoc. 19.25, cf. Pl. Phd. 114e, Euthd. 280e, Aristid. 2.117 J.

data.quote: κακός, παθεῖν μὲν εὖ, παθεῖν δὲ θάτερα
ἀγάθʼ ἢ θάτερα, ἵνα μηδὲν εἴπω φλαῦρον
ἐὰν τὰ ἕ. ψηφίσωνται οἱ δικασταί

children.label: a
children.definition: τῇ ἑτέρᾳ (sc. χειρί), Ep. ἑτέρῃ or ἑτέρηφι, with one hand (v. sub init.); with the left hand, Od. 3.441, Il. 22.80, Theoc. 24.45: hence prov., οὐ τῇ ἑτέρᾳ ληπτός not to be caught with one hand, Pl. Sph. 226a; ἐκ δʼ ἑτέρης A.R. 1.1115, AP 9.650 ( Leont.).

children.label: b
children.definition: θατέρᾳ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ) on the morrow, S. OT 782, E. Rh. 449; τῆς ἑτέρας Pl. Cri. 44a; but τῇ ἑτέρᾳ on the following ( i.e. the third) day, X. Cyr. 4.6.10.

children.label: c
children.definition: ὁδῷ) in another or a different way, καὶ τῇδε φῦναι χἀτέρᾳ S. OC 1444; another way, τρέπεσθαι Ar. Nu. 812; ἑτέρᾳ πῃ Id. Eq. 35; τότʼ ἄλλοσʼ . . , θατέρᾳ δὲ . . S. Tr. 272; θατέρᾳ . . , θατέρᾳ . . in one way . . , in the other . . , Henioch. 5.16 ; ἑτέρηφι Hes. Op. 216: acc. ἑτέραν ἐκτρέπεσθαι Luc. Tim. 5.

children.label: a
children.definition: ἐπὶ θάτερα to the one or the other side, one or the other way, ἐπὶ μὲν θάτερα . . , ἐπὶ θ. δὲ . . Hp. Art. 7; τότε μὲν ἐπὶ θάτερα, τότε δʼ ἐπὶ θ. Pl. Sph. 259c: also with another Prep., ἐς τὰ ἐπὶ θάτερα to or on the other side, Th. 1.87; ἐκ τοῦ ἐπὶ θάτερα from the other side, Id. 7.37; ἐκ μὲν τοῦ ἐπὶ θ., ἐκ δὲ τοῦ ἐπὶ θ. Pl. Prt. 314e: c. gen., ἐς τὰ ἐπὶ θ. τοῦ ποταμοῦ Th. 7.84; εἰς τἀπὶ θ. τῆς πόλεως X. HG 6.2.7; τὸ ἐπὶ θάτερον τῆς ῥινός Hp. Art. 35.

data.quote: ἐς τὰ ἐπὶ θ. τοῦ ποταμοῦ

children.label: b
children.definition: κατὰ θάτερα on the one or other side, κατὰ θ. ἀστός D. 57.30; ψόφου κατὰ θ. προσπεσόντος Plu. Brut. 51, etc.; but καθʼ ἕτερα at other points, Th. 7.42.

children.label: V
children.definition: Adv. ἑτέρως in one or the other way, opp. ἀμφοτέρως, Pl. Tht. 181e; ἑ. τε καὶ ἑ., = ἀμφοτέρως, Id. Phdr. 235a; τοῦ σκέλους ἑ. ἔχειν, = ἑτεροσκελὴς εἶναι, Philostr. VA 3.39.

differently, rarely in Poetry, οὐχ ἑ. τις ἐρεῖ Theoc. Ep. 10.3; ἑ. ἔχειν to be different, Ar. Pl. 371: freq. in Prose, ὡς ἑ. in the other way (cf. ὡς) , ἢν ἡ ἑτέρη γνάθος ἐκστῇ ὡς ἑ. χρὴ τὴν ἐπίδεσιν ἄγειν Hp. Art. 34, cf. Pl. Sph. 266a, etc.; ἐάν τε καλῶς, ἐάν θʼ ὡς ἑ. D. 18.85, cf. 212: c. gen., differently from, ἑ. πως τῶν εἰωθότων Pl. Plt. 295d; ἑ. ἤπερ . . Ael. NA 12.28.

data.quote: ἢν ἡ ἑτέρη γνάθος ἐκστῇ ὡς ἑ. χρὴ τὴν ἐπίδεσιν ἄγειν

children.definition: otherwise than should be, badly, wrongly, once in Hom., ἑ. ἐβόλοντο Od. 1.234; εἰ καὶ ἑ. τοῦτο ἀπέβη SIG 851.10 (Marc.Aur.); εἴ τι ἑ. φρονεῖτε Ep.Phil. 3.15.
of different signification, Eust. 1411.43. Adv. - τως Sch. Hes. Sc. 354.
with uneven legs, Hippiatr. 13; of a triangle, scalene, Poll. 4.161.
throwing a shadow only one way (at noon), of those who live north and south of the tropics, Posidon. ap. Str. 2.5.43, Cleom. 1.7.
darting from the other side, Nonn. D. 38.244.
belonging to the other series, Hsch., Phot.
one-edged, πέλεκυς Poll. 1.137.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑ. φάλαγξ a marching formation in which the λοχαγοί of the leading κέρας are on the r., those of the rear κέρας on the l., or vice versa, Ascl. Tact. 10.22, etc. Adv. - μως ib. 11.4.
consisting of two different strophes, Heph. Poëm. 5.3, Sch. Ar. Nu. 263.
having one wrist-pulse different from the other, Marcellin. Puls. 147:—hence ἑτερο-σφυξία, ἡ, Gal. 18(2).301.
differently formed: τὸ ἑ. change of grammatical form, as a figure of speech, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
of varying shape, φύλλα Thphr. HP 1.10.1; altered in shape, distorted, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 51. Adv. -μόνως Vett.Val. 333.20:— later ἑτερό-σχημος, ον, irregular, διαλείμματα Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.20.15.
belonging to a different series or order, opp. ὁμοταγής, Procl. Inst. 21, Dam. Pr. 38.
otherness, difference, λέγω γένους διαφορὰν -τητα Arist. Metaph. 1058a8, cf. Ph. 201b20, Epicur. Nat. 49 G., etc.; opp. ταυτότης, Plu. An.procr. 2.1013a, etc.: pl., Phld. Rh. 1.8 S.
civil discord, ἑ. καὶ διαφορά Plu. Num. 17.
with neck turned to one side, of Alexander, Tz. H. 11 No. 368 tit.
of different sort or fashion, κακόν Ar. Th. 724; γαλεῶν ἑ. φῦλα Opp. H. 1.379; various, τύχης ἑ. ὁρμή AP 9.768 ( Agath.), cf. Nonn. D. 2.669, 7.7.
one-eared, one-handled, An.Ox. 2.7, Eust. 870.2.
vessel with one handle, Hsch.
diverse in appearance, Gal. 18(1).777.
difference of the two eyes, Hippiatr. 13, Dem. Ophth. ap. Simon. Jan. s.v. ethereoftalmia.
one-eyed, D. 24.141, Arist. Metaph. 1023a5; ἑ. γενομένη ἡ Ἑλλάς, metaph., of the proposed destruction of Athens, Leptines ap. Arist. Rh. 1411a5, cf. Demad. 65 B., Plu. Praec. 2.803a.

children.label: II
children.definition: with different-coloured eyes, Gp. 16.2.1.
Tim. Lex. s.v. ταλαντοῦσθαι.
to be distraught, Epicur. Sent.Vat. 17.
difference of opinion, discord, Iamb. VP 7.34.
thinking strangely, raving, Tryph. 439; λύσσα AP 1.19 ( Claudian.), cf. Nonn. D. 9.49.
of different nature, Anon. in Cat. 61.8.
of another race or breed, Ael. NA 16.27, Scymn. 101; opp. πολίτης, Iamb. VP 16.69: generally, differing in kind, πρός τι Dam. Pr. 74; of different kinds, Simp. in Ph. 890.16.
grafted tree, Jul. Ep. 180.
to be different in sound, Eust. 1626.3.
diversity of note, ἑ. καὶ ποικιλία τῆς λύρας Pl. Lg. 812d; περὶ ἑτεροφωνίας τῶν ὁμογενῶν, title of work, Thphr. Fr. 181.
of different voice: hence, foreign, A. Th. 170 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: discrepant, opp. σύμφωνος, Porph. Chr. 15.
with unequal hoofs, Hippiatr. 109.
to be of different colour, AB 386; to be discoloured, of bones, Orib. 46.11.7.
difference of colour, Hierocl. p.21 A., Xenocr. 28, Gal. 14.325.
Polem.Phgn. 9.
difference of colour, Pyrrho ap. D.L. 9.86.
of different times: τὸ ἑ. a change of tense, as a figure of speech, Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
of different colour, Thphr. CP 5.3.2; of varied colours, χορὸς ὀρνίθων Nonn. D. 5.186: heterocl. dat. and acc. ἑτερόχροϊ, -χροα, ib. 12.305, 5.58.

children.label: II
children.definition: piebald, βοῦς Porph. Abst. 4.7.
Hippiatr. 14.
Poll. 9.98.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑτερόχρωτες ὕπνοι sleep with one of different sex, Luc. Am. 42.

definition: ἑτέρωθεν (or ἕτερωθε Hes. Sc. 281, cf. A.D. Adv. 194.4), Adv.

children.definition: from the other side, Il. 1.247, al.; ἐκ δʼ ἑτέρωθεν v.l. in Theoc. 22.91.
on the other side, opposite, ἕστηκʼ Il. 3.230, cf. 6.247.

children.label: II
children.definition: from another quarter, from outside, Lys. 17.4, Pl. Lg. 702c, Arist. EN 1121a34, Bato 5.9.
on the other side, ἔνθεν . . , ἑ. δὲ . . Od. 12.235: in later Prose, Ph. 1.301, Jul. Or. 2.69a.

children.label: II
children.definition: elsewhere, Il. 5.351, 15.348, Od. 4.531, Pl. Prm. 146c, etc.; οὐδαμόθι ἑ. nowhere else, Hdt. 3.113; ἑ. πανταχοῦ anywhere else, Antipho 6.39; λέγει ἑ. ὅτι in another passage, Ph. 1.372, cf. Hdt. 9.58: c. gen., ἑ. τοῦ λόγου in another part of my story, Id. 6.19; ἑ. που τοῦ σώματος Arist. PA 663b3.

children.label: III
children.definition: at another time, τότε μὲν . . , ἑ. δὲ . . Hdt. 3.35.
anotherʼs property, Eust. 1214.27, cf. Hsch.
to have a different denominator, Nicom. Ar. 1.17.
with different designation, Simp. in Cat. 38, Procl. in Prm. p.955 S.

children.label: II
children.definition: with different denominator, Nicom. Ar. 1.13, al.
difference of name, Eust. 304.24.
to the other side, Il. 4.492, Od. 16.179; ἔνθεν μὲν . . , ἑ. δὲ . . Pl. Sph. 224a; on one side, ἑ. κάρη βάλεν Il. 8.306, cf. Od. 22.17.
on the other side, οἱ δʼ ἑ. καθῖζον Il. 20.151; κἂν ἑ. πατάξῃ τις D. 4.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: elsewhither, aside, ἑ. λιασθείς Il. 23.231; κύνες ἑ. φόβηθεν Od. 16.163, etc.; ἑ. τρέχων Ar. Ach. 828; also εἰς ἑ. A.R. 4.1315.
elsewhere, Luc. Charid. 22.

definition: ἐτέρωτα, Aeol. for ἑτέρωθι, Sapph. 1.5, cf. A.D. Adv. 194.5.
ἐτέτυμον ἀληθές, ἢ ἀληθῶς, Hsch. ἐτεωνέω· ἀληθεύω, and ἐτεώνια· ἀληθῆ, Id.; cf. ἐτεός.

children.definition: one year old, ἐτῆρας ἀμνοὺς θεοῖς ἔρεξʼ ἐπακτίοις S. Fr. 751 (v.l. εὔειρας).
term of years, Hierocl. Facet. 62.

definition: ἔτης, ὁ, Elean ϝέτας (v. infr.), in Hom. always in pl. ἔται, οἱ:—

children.definition: clansmen, i.e. kinsmen and dependents of a great house, ἀμύνων σοῖσιν ἔτῃσι Il. 6.262; δαινύντα γάμον πολλοῖσι ἔτῃσιν Od. 4.3; παῖδάς τε κασιγνήτους τε ἔτας τε Il. 6.239, cf. Od. 15.273; ἔται καὶ ἀνεψιοί Il. 9.464; ἔτας καὶ ἑταίρους 7.295; γείτονες ἠδὲ ἔται Od. 4.16.

data.quote: παῖδάς τε κασιγνήτους τε ἔτας τε

children.label: II
children.definition: citizen, ἔταις ἀμαχανίαν ἀλέξων τεοῖσιν Pi. Pae. 6.10, cf. Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.4; τὼς ἔτας καττὰ πάτρια δικάζεσθαι Foed.Lac. in Th. 5.79: in sg., a private citizen, opp. those who hold office, πρός σε . . ὡς ἔτην λέγω A. Supp. 247; οὔτε δῆμος οὔτʼ ἔτης ἀνήρ Id. Fr. 377; ἀρχῷ, φωτὶ δʼ οὐκ ἔτῃ πρέπων E. Fr. 1014; αἴτε ϝέτας αἴτε τελεστά SIG 9.8 ( Olympia, vi B.C.), cf. 141.12 (Corc. nigra, iv B.C.), Mus.Belg. 16.70 ( Athens, ii A. D.), IG 5(2).20 ( Tegea). (On the breathing, see Hdn.Gr. 2.55.)

data.quote: ἀρχῷ, φωτὶ δʼ οὐκ ἔτῃ πρέπων

definition: ἐτησίαι, οἱ, gen. ἐτησίων Hdn.Gr. 1.425: ( ἔτος):—with or without ἄνεμοι,

children.definition: periodic winds, esp. those blowing from north-west during the summer, Hdt. 2.20, 6.140, cf. Hp. Aër. 10, D. 4.31, Arist. Mete. 361b35; of the southerly monsoon in the Indian Ocean, Arr. An. 6.21.1; Εὖροι ἐ. Posidon. ap. Str. 3.2.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: King of the Dog-days, PCair.Zen. 19.6 (iii B.C.), Porph. Fr.Hist. 4.6.

definition: ἐτησιάς, άδος, poet. fem. of sq., epith. of αὔρη, Nonn. D. 12.286.
ἐτήσιος, ον, and in Hp. η, ον: ( ἔτος):—

children.definition: lasting a year, πένθος οὐκ ἐ. E. Alc. 336; προστασία f.l. in Th. 2.80; ἐτησίους ἄρχειν to govern for a year, D.C. 60.24.

annual, ὧραι Plu. Es. carn. 1 2.993e; θυσίαι Th. 5.11, etc., cf. SIG 1024.24 ( Myconus); φόρος IG 7.2227 ( Thisbe); ἐτήσιοι πρόσιτʼ ἀεί Cratin. 23; βορέαι ἐ., = ἐτησίαι, Arist. Pr. 940a35; ἐ. πνεύματα Arr. Ind. 21.1. Adv. - ίως Sch. Lyc. 107: neut. as Adv., τρυγόωσιν ἐτήσιον AP 5.226 ( Maced.).
truth, Call. Aet. 3.1.76 [Fr. 75.76 Pf.], AP 9.771 ( Jul.), Max. 462, Orph. Fr. 280.7.

definition: ἐτήτυμος, ον, poet. redupl. for ἔτυμος,

children.definition: true, οὐκ ἔσθʼ ὅδε μῦθος ἐ. Od. 23.62; ἐ. ἄγγελος ἐλθών Il. 22.438; ἐτήτυμα μυθησαίμην Hes. Op. 10; τοῦτʼ ἀγόρευσον ἐτήτυμον tell me this true, Od. 1.174; τοῦτʼ ἐ.; c. inf., is this true, that . . ? A. Pers. 737 (troch.); εἰ λέγεις ἐτήτυμα S. Ph. 1290; τὸ δʼ ἐ. but the truth is . . , Ar. Pax 119.
truthful, οὐ ψευδόμαντις . . , ἀλλʼ ἐ. E. Or. 1667; ἐ. στόμα Id. IT 1085.

genuine, real, κείνῳ δʼ οὐκέτι νόστος ἐ. for him there remains no true, real return, Od. 3.241; ἀλάθεια, κλέος, Pi. O. 10(11).54, N. 7.63; ἐ. Διὸς κόρα A. Ch. 948; παῖς ἐ. γεγώς S. Tr. 1064; χρυσός Theoc. 12.37: in late Prose, Them. Or. 22.279d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv., in neut. ἐτήτυμον, truly, really, Od. 4.157, Il. 13.111, 18.128, Archil. 62 : regul. Adv. - μως A. Ag. 167 (lyr.), 682 (lyr.); ὡς ἐ. S. El. 1452.

yet, still, ἔ. μοι μένος ἔμπεδον Il. 5.254; ἔ. τυτθὸν ἐόντα 6.222; εἰ Ζεὺς ἔ. Ζεύς S. OC 623 ; ἔτʼ ἐκ βρέφεος ever since babyhood, AP 9.567 ( Antip.); ἔ. καὶ νῦν Il. 1.455; ἔ. καὶ ἐκ παρόντων v.l. in Th. 7.77; ἔτʼ ἂν ἐκ τῶνδε θεὸς χρῄζων θείη A. Ch. 340; ἔ. καὶ νυνί Pl. Smp. 215d; νῦν ἔ. ζεῖ A. Th. 708 (lyr.), cf. Ag. 818.

data.quote: ἔτʼ ἂν ἐκ τῶνδε θεὸς χρῄζων θείη

children.definition: impf., ἀήθεσσον γὰρ ἔτʼ αὐτῶν Il. 10.493, cf. Hdt. 9.102, Th. 5.111, etc.: with aor., Pl. Prt. 310c, etc.; ἔ. πρότερον, πρόσθεν, Th. 8.45, Pl. Sph. 242d: with the sense, already, γεγονέναι ἔ. οὐχ ἧττον ἢ εἶναι Id. Men. 93a.

data.quote: γεγονέναι ἔ. οὐχ ἧττον ἢ εἶναι

children.definition: yet, longer, ἄλγεʼ ἔδωκεν . . ἠδʼ ἔ. δώσει Il. 1.96, cf. 5.465: c. opt., ἔ . . . φιλέοι Od. 15.305: c. imper., μή τις ἔ . . . ἔστω 2.230; hereafter, A. Pr. 907, S. El. 66, Ar. V. 758 (anap.), etc.
longer, οὐδὲ . . ἔ. παρέμειναν D.H. 5.46; v. οὐκέτι, μηκέτι.

children.label: II
children.definition: still, besides, ἐς δεκάτην γενεὴν ἕτερόν γʼ ἔ. βόσκοι another (and another and so on), Od. 14.325; ἔτʼ ἄλλο Hes. Op. 157, cf. Il. 6.411, Od. 11.623, S. Ant. 218, etc.; τίνʼ οὖν ἔτʼ ἄλλον . . ; A. Ch. 114; πρὸς τοῖσδʼ ἔ., πρὸς τούτοις ἔ. (cf. προσέτι), S. Ph. 1339, Ar. Nu. 720 (anap.); ἔ. τε and besides, nay more, Pl. Phdr. 279a; ἔ. τοσόνδε this further point, Id. Tht. 184b; ἔ. δὲ καί Th. 1.80, etc.; πρῶτον μὲν . . , ἔπειτα δὲ . . , ἔ. δὲ . . X. An. 6.6.13; ἔ. καί alone, τά τε εἴδωλα, ἔ. καὶ τὰ γεγραμμένα Pl. Sph. 239d; ἔτι καὶ ἔ. ἀεί Theol.Ar. 30.

data.quote: τά τε εἴδωλα, ἔ. καὶ τὰ γεγραμμένα

children.definition: Comp., ἔ. μᾶλλον yet more, Il. 14.97, 362; μᾶλλον ἔ. Od. 18.22; ἔ. καὶ μ. Pi. P. 10.57; καὶ ἔ. καὶ μᾶλλον Ael. NA 16.24; ἔ. πλέον Hdt. 7.6 ; πλέον ἔ. Th. 1.80; παῖς τε κἄτι τοῦδʼ ἀνούστερος A. Pr. 987; πότμῳ τῷ νῦν . . κἄτι τοῦδʼ ἐχθίονι S. OT 272, cf. El. 559, 1189.

data.quote: πότμῳ τῷ νῦν . . κἄτι τοῦδʼ ἐχθίονι

children.definition: ἔ. ἄνω yet higher up, X. An. 7.5.9; ἔ. μάλα Ar. Pax 53, 462, Ra. 864. (Skt. áti ‘beyond’, Lat. et, Goth. ip ‘but’, ‘however’.)
like soup, ἕψημα Phaenias ap. Ath. 9.406c.
soup-ladle, Ar. Ach. 245, Fr. 779.

definition: ἐτνίτης, Dor. ἐτν-ίτας [ ῑ], ἄρτος, ὁ,

children.definition: Eucrat. ap. Ath. 3.111b, Seleuc. ib. 114b.
soup-stirring, τορύνα AP 6.305 ( Leon.), 306 (Aristo).

thick soup made with pease or beans, Ar. Ach. 246, Ra. 62, 506, Pl. Hp.Ma. 290d; ἔ. πίσινον Ar. Eq. 1171; φάκινον Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 53; κυάμινον Gal. Vict.Att. 53; as poultice, τὸ ἔτνος τὸ ἐκ τῶν κυάμων Lycus ap. Orib. 9.35.1. ( ἑτνος from a false deriv. from ἕω, EM 387.9, etc.)

definition: ἑτοιμάζω, pf. ἡτοίμακα Plb. 3.72.6: pf. Pass. ἡτοίμασμαι both in med. and pass. sense v. infr.): ( ἑτοῖμος):—

children.definition: get ready, prepare, ἐμοὶ γέρας αὐτίχʼ ἑτοιμάσατʼ Il. 1.118; [ νέας] Hdt. 6.95; στρατιώτας Act.Ap. 23.23; ὁδόν LXX Is. 40.3, al.; ἔγκλημα μικρὸν αἰτίαν τε S. Tr. 361; δῶμα E. Alc. 364; βουλήν Id. Heracl. 472; δάκρυα δʼ ἑτοιμάζουσι to those furnishing them, Id. Supp. 454; ἀργύριον ῥητόν Th. 2.7, etc.; ἑαυτὸν ἵνα . . Apoc. 8.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., cause to be prepared, ὄφρʼ ἱρὸν ἑτοιμασσαίατʼ Ἀθήνῃ Il. 10.571; ἑτοιμάσσαντο δὲ ταύρους Od. 13.184, cf. Hdt. 8.24; ἑτοιμασάμενος ἃ δεῖ Inscr.Prien. 55.34 (ii B.C.).

pf. Pass. ἡτοίμασμαι, prepare for oneself, τἄλλα ἡτοιμάζετο made his other arrangements, Th. 4.77; ὅπως ἑτοιμάσαιντο τιμωρίαν Id. 1.58; πλείονα ἡτοιμασμένος X. Cyr. 3.3.5; τροφὴν ἡτοιμασμένοι D. 23.209; τὰ πρὸς τὸν βίον Epicur. Sent.Vat. 30, cf. Metrod. Fr. 53.
prepare oneself, make oneself ready, c. inf., X. Ap. 8; πρὸς τὴν χειμασίαν Plb. 3.105.11.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be prepared, ἔλεγε ἡτοιμάσθαι that preparations had been made, Th. 6.64, cf. 7.62, etc.; ἑ. τι to be prepared with . . , Plb. 8.30.7.
readiness, πρὸς τὰς ὑπουργίας Hp. Decent. 12; εἰς ἑ. ὑμῶν παρέχειν to place at your disposal, J. AJ 10.1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: preparation, ἀρμένων Aen.Tact. 21.1, cf. LXX Ps. 9.38 ( 10.17); τροφῆς ib. Wi. 13.12; equipment, ἐν -ασίᾳ εὐαγγελίου Ep.Eph. 6.15.
easily moved to tears, Eust. 115.30.
light sleep, Steph. in Hp. 1.146 D.
ready for death, Str. 15.1.59.
one who gives rolls freely, Com.Adesp. 1094.
officiousness, Hp. Praec. 12 (s.v.l.).
talkative, Phot. s.v. εὑρεσίλογος.
ready to censure, Eust. 873.3.
ready to obey, Hdn. Epim. 38.
inclined to fall, gloss on ἀκροσφαλής, AB 367.
cook-shop where dressed meats are sold, BGU 1647.6 (ii A. D.).
one who keeps such a shop [ἑτοιμοπωλεῖον, where dressed meats are sold], Demetr. Astrol. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.106.
Gloss.

definition: ἑτοῖμος, ον, also fem. ἑτοίμη Il. 9.425, Hp. Art. 66, - μᾱ S. El. 1079 (lyr.), etc.:—in v B. C. and later ἕτοιμος, η, ον, or ος, ον, cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.938:—

children.definition: at hand, ready, prepared, ὀνείαθʼ ἑτοῖμα προκείμενα Od. 14.453, etc.; τὶν δʼ αἶνος ἑτοῖμος Pi. O. 6.12; [ τὰ κρέα] εἶχε ἕτοιμα Hdt. 1.119, cf. 3.123; ἑτοιμοτάταν ἐπὶ δαῖτα Theoc. 13.63, cf. E. Cyc. 357 (lyr.); ἕ. χρήματα money in hand, Hdt. 5.31; ἐξ ἑ. in ready money, POxy. 2106.23 (iv A.D.); ἕ. ἀεὶ παρακείμενον ἐκμαγεῖον Pl. Ti. 72c; ἕ. ποιήσασθαι to make ready, Hdt. 1.11; ὡς ἑτοῖμα ἦν Th. 2.3; ἐπειδὴ αὐτῷ ἑ. ἦν ib. 98; ἐξ ἑτοίμου at once and without hesitation, immediately, offhand, ἐξ ἑ. λαμβάνειν Isoc. 5.96; ἐξ ἑ. ὑπακούειν X. Oec. 14.3; ἐξ ἑτοιμοτάτου διώκειν Id. Cyr. 5.3.57; ἐξ ἑ. φίλον εἶναι Id. Mem. 2.6.16; γίνεται ταῦτα ἐξ -οτάτου are most likely to attack, Hp. Prog. 24; ἐν ἑτοίμῳ ἐστί Epicur. Ep. 3p.62U., cf. Theoc. 22.61; ἐν ἑ. ἔχειν Plb. 2.34.2, 2 Ep.Cor. 10.6, etc.; ἑτοιμότερα γέλωτος λίβη tears that came more readily than . . , A. Ch. 448; τὰ ἑ. that which is ready to hand, ἐπὶ τὰ ἑ. μᾶλλον τρέπονται Th. 1.20; τὰ ἑ. βλάψαι ib. 70; τοῖς ἑ. περὶ τῶν ἀφανῶν . . κινδυνεύειν Id. 6.9.

data.quote: τοῖς ἑ. περὶ τῶν ἀφανῶν . . κινδυνεύειν

children.definition: sure to come, certain, αὐτίκα γάρ τοι ἔπειτα μεθʼ Ἕκτορα πότμος ἑ. Il. 18.96; χώλωσις ἑτοίμη τοῖσι περιγινομένοισι Hp. Art. 66; also, easy to be done, feasible, ἐπεὶ οὔ σφισιν ἥδε γʼ ἑτοίμη (sc. μῆτις) Il. 9.425; ἕ. [ἐστι] τὸ διαφθαρῆναι imminent, Plu. QConv. 2.706c: c. inf., ἕ. μᾶλλόν [ἐστι] ἀπεχθάνεσθαι Pl. R. 567a, cf. E. HF 86; οὐ γάρ τι ἕ. μεταπεῖσαι it is not easy . . , Paus. 2.23.6.

data.quote: αὐτίκα γάρ τοι ἔπειτα μεθʼ Ἕκτορα πότμος ἑ.

children.definition: carried into effect, realized, ταῦτα ἑ. τετεύχαται Il. 14.53; ἠδʼ ἄρʼ ἑτοῖμα τέτυκτο and this promise has been made good, Od. 8.384.

children.label: II
children.definition: ready, active, zealous, ἕ. ἦν ἐμοὶ σειραφόρος A. Ag. 842; τινι in or for a thing, Pi. O. 4.16; ἐς τι for a thing, Hdt. 8.96; πρός τι X. Mem. 4.5.12: c. dat. pers., ready to assist or go with him, etc., Pi. N. 4.74, Hdt. 1.70: c. inf., ready to do, ib. 42, 113, al.; ἐπιστενάχειν πᾶς τις ἕ. A. Ag. 791; χωρεῖν ἑ. S. Aj. 813, cf. Ant. 264, Antipho 6.23, Ar. V. 341 (lyr.); ὑπακούειν ἑτοιμότεροι too ready . . , Th. 4.61; θηρία ἕ. διαμάχεσθαι Pl. Smp. 207b: c. Art., τὸ μὴ βλέπειν ἑτοίμα S. El. 1079 (lyr.); ἦν ἕτοιμος, abs., he was ready, Hdt. 1.10; ἑ. ἔχειν τινάς Id. 3.45; ἑ. ποιέεσθαί τινας Id. 5.86.
ready, bold, λῆμα Ar. Nu. 458 (lyr.); ἡ γνώμη Th. 4.123; τὸ ἕ. readiness, resolution, E. Or. 1106; τὸ ἕ. τῆς γνώμης Philostr. Her. 8.1; τὰ θερμά τε καὶ ἕ. τῶν θηρίων Id. VA 7.14.

data.quote: τὰ θερμά τε καὶ ἕ. τῶν θηρίων

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. - μως readily, willingly, Th. 1.80; ἑ. ἔχω τελευτᾶν I am ready to die, Demad. 4, cf. D. 18.161, PAmh. 2.32.6 (ii B.C.), Act.Ap. 21.13; ἑ. ἥκειν X. An. 2.5.2; διδόναι IG 2(2).956.24; ἑ. παρορᾷς evidently, Pl. Hp.Ma. 300c: Comp. ἑτοιμότερον Is. 4.14, - οτέρως Alex.Trall. 12: Sup. - ότατα Pl. Plt. 290a.
readiness, πρὸς τὸ ποιεῖν ὁτιοῦν D. 54.36; λόγων ἑ. power of speaking offhand, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.6e, cf. Cam. 32: pl., M.Ant. 4.12; of things, ἑ. κτήσεως Phld. Oec. p.46 J.; aptitude, Ph. 1.392.

children.label: II
children.definition: predisposition, Plot. 6.1.8; in Medic. sense, Gal. 7.291.
ready to cut, χεῖρες AP 9.282 (Antip. Thess.).
easily decomposed, Steph. in Hp. 1.102 D.

definition: ἔτος, εος, τό, irreg. dat. ἔτῃ IG 2.1059.18:—

children.definition: year, τῶν προτέρων ἐτέων in bygone years, Il. 11.691; τόδʼ ἐεικοστὸν ἔ. ἐστὶν ἐξ οὗ . . 24.765, cf. Od. 2.89, 19.222; ὅτε . . ὄγδοόν μοι ἐπιπλόμενον ἔ. ἦλθε 7.261; ἔ. ἐνιαυτῶν, v. ἐνιαυτός; ἑκάστου ἔτους Pl. Phd. 58b; ἀνʼ ἕκαστον ἔ. Thphr. HP 4.4.4; ἀνὰ πᾶν ἔ. AP 9.430 ( Crin.); ἀνὰ πάντα ἔτεα Hdt. 8.65; διʼ ἔτους πέμπτου every fifth year, Ar. Pl. 584; κατὰ ἔ. every year, Th. 4.53, D.S. 3.2, Ev.Luc. 2.41, etc. (freq. καθʼ ἕ., as PPetr. 3p.34 (iii B.C.) and later); ἔ. εἰς ἔ. year after year, S. Ant. 340 (lyr.); διʼ ἔτους annually, Ph. 1.19, 378; εἰς ἔ. Theoc. Ep. 13.4; εἰς ἔ. ἐξ ἔτεος Id. 18.15; ἔ. ἐξ ἔτους LXX Le. 25.50; παρὰ ἔ. every other year, Paus. 9.32.3 (but πὰρ ϝέτος yearly, Tab.Heracl. 1.101); πάλαι πολλὰ ἤδη ἔτη Pl. Ap. 18b; τρίτῳ ἔτει Th. 1.101; τρίτῳ ἔτεϊ πρότερον Hdt. 6.40; τρίτῳ ἔτεϊ τούτων in the third year after this, ibid., etc.; freq. in acc., ἔ. τόδʼ ἤδη δέκατον . . βόσκων now for these ten years, S. Ph. 312; τύραννος ἐγεγόνει ἤδη χιλιοστὸν ἔτος Pl. R. 615c, cf. D. 3.4, 33.23; of a personʼs age, γεγονὼς ἔτη τρία ἀπολείποντα τῶν ἑκατόν Isoc. 12.270; οἱ ὑπὲρ τὰ στρατεύσιμα ἔτη γεγονότες X. Cyr. 1.2.4, cf. 13, etc.; without γεγονώς, τοὺς ὑπὲρ τετταράκοντα ἔτη Id. An. 5.3.1; οἱ μέχρι τετταράκοντα ἐτῶν ib. 6.4.25, etc.: in gen., ἐπειδὰν ἐτῶν ᾖ τις τριάκοντα Pl. Lg. 721b; μυρίων ἐτῶν within a period of 10,000 years, Id. Phdr. 248e; ὥρα ἔτους, v. ὥρα I.

data.quote: ὅτε . . ὄγδοόν μοι ἐπιπλόμενον ἔ. ἦλθε
γεγονὼς ἔτη τρία ἀπολείποντα τῶν ἑκατόν
οἱ ὑπὲρ τὰ στρατεύσιμα ἔτη γεγονότες

children.definition: regnal year, τὸ πέμπτον ἔ. Δομιτιανοῦ POxy. 477.8 (ii A.D.). ( ϝέτος SIG 9.2 ( Olympia, vi B.C.), Berl.Sitzb. 1927.8 ( Locr., v B.C.), Inscr.Cypr. 135.1 H., Tab.Heracl. l.c.; cf. Lat. vetus.)
without reason, in vain, only with neg., οὐκ ἐτός no wonder, Ar. Ach. 411, al., Philetaer. 5, Anaxil. 30, Pl. R. 414e, 568a; οὐκ ἐτὸς ἄρʼ ἦσθα δεινὴ καὶ σοφή Ar. Ec. 245, cf. Pl. 404.

data.quote: οὐκ ἐτὸς ἄρʼ ἦσθα δεινὴ καὶ σοφή

children.definition: true, Hsch., perh. to be read in Crates Com. 8: neut. pl. ἐτά truly, Call. Fr.anon. 283.

definition: ἑτός, ή, όν, verb. Adj. of ἵημι,

children.definition: sent, only in compds., as ἀν-ετός, ἀφ-ετός. ἔτρᾰγον, aor. 2 of τρώγω. ἔττακαν· ἔστησαν, Hsch.

definition: ἐττημένος, η, ον, perf. part. Pass. of * ττάω (cf. δια-ττάω),

children.definition: sifted, Pherecr. 211; ἐττησμένα Hsch.
derive, ἀπὸ αἰτίας ὄνομα Procl. in Cra. p.43P.
speaking truth, Orph. A. 4, 1178.
true oak, Quercus Robur, Thphr. HP 3.8.2, 7.
argue from etymology, Diogenian. Epicur. 2.18, Gal. 5.214.

children.label: II
children.definition: analyse a word and find its origin, Πλάτων -λογῶν τὸν οἶνον Ath. 2.35b, cf. Corn. ND 32; ἐ. τι ἀπό τινος ib. 1, Str. 1.2.34; ἔκ τινος An.Ox. 3.220; παρά τι EM 220.37; πρός τι Phlp. in de An. 92.4:— Pass., -εῖσθαι ταῖς Ἑλληνικαῖς φωναῖς Str. 13.1.52.
etymology, Str. 16.4.29, D.H. Comp. 16, A.D. Adv. 153.13, Ph. 1.354, etc.

belonging to ἐτυμολογία, Eust. 1799.25; -κά, τά, title of work by Chrysipp. ( Stoic. 2.9, al.); ἡ -κή the science of etymology, Varr. LL 7.109; τὸ -κόν an etymological dictionary, EM 212.13 (pl.), Sch. Il. 13.130 (pl.), etc. Adv. -κῶς Eust. 396.15.
studying etymology: as Subst., ἐ., ὁ, etymologist, EM 199.24, Varr. LL 6.39.

definition: ἔτυμος, ον, also η, ον S. Ph. 205 (lyr.) (only in neut. in Hom.):— poet. Adj.

children.definition: true, ψεύσομαι, ἦ ἔτυμον ἐρέω; Il. 10.534; φάμʼ ἔτυμον S. Ant. 1320 (lyr.), cf. Call. Fr. 1.39 P.; ψεύδεα πολλὰ λέγων ἐτύμοισιν ὁμοῖα Od. 19.203, cf. Hes. Th. 27, Thgn. 713; οἵ ῥʼ ἔτυμα κραίνουσι those [dreams] have true issues, Od. 19.567; γνώσει τάδʼ ὡς ἔ. A. Pr. 295 (anap.); ἔ. λόγος Stesich. 32, Pi. P. 1.68; ἔ. ἄγγελος, φήμη, φάτις, A. Th. 82 (lyr.), E. El. 818, Ar. Pax 114 (anap.); βάλλει μʼ ἐτύμα φθογγά S. Ph. 205 (lyr.); πάθεα A. Eu. 496; τέχνη Dor. ap. Pl. Phdr. 260e; ὡς ἔτυμʼ ἑστάκαντι how natural . . , Theoc. 15.82.

ἔτυμον, as Adv., ἀλλʼ ἔτυμόν τοι ἦλθʼ Ὀδυσεύς Od. 23.26; οὔ σʼ ἔτυμόν γε φάμεν πεπνῦσθαι Il. 23.440; ὡς ἔτυμον AP 7.352: regul. Adv. - μως Xenoph. 8.4, Pi. O. 6.77, A. Th. 918 (lyr.), B. 12.228, etc.; ὡς ἐτύμως A. Eu. 534 (lyr.).

data.quote: οὔ σʼ ἔτυμόν γε φάμεν πεπνῦσθαι

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔτυμον, τό, as Subst., the true sense of a word according to its origin, its etymology, D.S. 1.11, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.278c, Ath. 13.571d. Adv. - μως etymologically, Arist. Mu. 400a6, Str. 9.2.17, Ph. 1.30: Comp. - ώτερον EM 526.2: Sup. - ώτατα Nicom. Ar. 2.27.—Never in Att. Prose; in later writers only in signf. II, exc. in Pl. Ax. 366b.
true meaning of a word, Str. 5.4.10, 8.3.19, Plu. QConv. 2.638e.
working in vain or sluggishly, Hes. Op. 411.

definition: ἐτώσιος, ον, ( ἐτός A) Ep. Adj.

children.definition: to no purpose, fruitless, βέλος ὠκὺ ἐ. ἔκφυγε χειρός Il. 14.407; ἐτώσια πίπτει ἔραζε [βέλεα] 17.633; τὰ δὲ πάντα ἐ. θῆκεν Ἀθήνη made them fruitless, Od. 22.256; δῶρα δʼ ἐ. ταῦτα χαρίζεο 24.283; useless, unprofitable, ἐ. ἄχθος ἀρούρης Il. 18.104; ἐ. πόλλʼ ἀγορεύειν Hes. Op. 402; ἔργον ἐ. λιπεῖν to leave it undone, ib. 440; ἐτώσια χερσὶ προδεικνύς, i.e. making mere feints, not real blows, Theoc. 22.102: masc., first in Id. 25.236 ( ὀϊστός): fem., Orph. L. 539: neut. ἐτώσιον, as Adv., Id. A. 700; pl., ἐτώσια γηράσκοντας A.R. 2.893, cf. Theoc. 1.38: regul. Adv. - ίως Sch. Ar. Ec. 246.

definition: εὖ, Ep. also ἐΰ Od. 1.302, etc., cf. A.D. Adv. 200.20: Adv. (prop. neut. of ἐΰς):—

children.definition: well, opp. κακῶς (as in Th. 4.63), Hom., etc.

children.label: I
children.definition: well, thoroughly, competently, εὖ μέν τις δόρυ θηξάσθω, εὖ δʼ ἀσπίδα θέσθω Il. 2.382; εὖ καὶ ἐπισταμένως κέασαν ξύλα Od. 20.161; τὴν πόλιν κοσμέων καλῶς τε καὶ εὖ Hdt. 1.59; τὸ πρᾶγμα βασανίσας καλῶς τε καὶ εὖ Pl. Euthd. 307b, etc.; τόξων ἐῢ εἰδώς cunning with the bow, Il. 2.718, etc.; εὖ τόδʼ ἴσθι A. Pers. 173 (troch.); εὖ γὰρ σαφῶς τόδʼ ἴστε ib. 784; εὖ οἶδʼ ὅτι parenthetic in colloquial speech, σὺ γὰρ εὖ οἶδʼ ὅτι οὐ πράγματʼ ᾄσει Ar. Pax 1296, cf. D. 14.2, etc.; εὖ οἶδα, in answers, Dioxipp. 4; εὖ μήδεο consider well, Il. 2.360; εὖ λέγεις well spoken ! Pl. Ap. 24e, cf. D. 5.2, etc.: with λέγω omitted, οὐδὲ τοῦτʼ εὖ Ἐρατοσθένης Str. 1.3.1.

data.quote: εὖ μέν τις δόρυ θηξάσθω, εὖ δʼ ἀσπίδα θέσθω
τὴν πόλιν κοσμέων καλῶς τε καὶ εὖ
τὸ πρᾶγμα βασανίσας καλῶς τε καὶ εὖ
σὺ γὰρ εὖ οἶδʼ ὅτι οὐ πράγματʼ ᾄσει

children.definition: morally well, kindly, εὖ ἔρδειν, = εὐεργετεῖν, Il. 5.650; εὖ εἰπεῖν τινα to speak well of him, Od. 1.302; εὖ δρᾶν εὖ παθών S. Ph. 672, etc.

fortunately, happily, in good case, εὖ ζώουσι Od. 19.79; εὖ οἴκαδʼ ἱκέσθαι safely, Il. 1.19, cf. Od. 3.188; τοῦ βίου εὖ ἥκειν Hdt. 1.30; εὖ φρονῶν in oneʼs right mind, A. Pr. 387, etc. (but εὖ φρονεῖν εἴς τινας, τὰ σά, to be well-disposed towards, And. 2.4, S. Aj. 491); standing last for emphasis, ἄνδρες γεγονότες εὖ Hdt. 7.134; νόμους μὴ λύειν ἔχοντας εὖ Id. 3.82; τελευτήσει τὸν βίον εὖ Id. 1.32, cf. Th. 1.71, Arist. EN 1124b13, etc.: separated from its Verb, εὖ πρᾶγμα συντεθέν D. 18.144.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὖ μάλα Od. 4.96, etc.; ἡ ἀορτὴ εὖ μάλα κοίλη Arist. HA 514b22; εὖ μάλα πᾶσαι h.Ap. 171; εὖ μάλα πολλά Heraclit. 35; εὖ μάλα πρεσβύτης Pl. Euthphr. 4a; μάλα εὖ καὶ κομψῶς Id. Sph. 236d; εὖ καὶ μάλα Id. Smp. 194a (sed cf. CQ 15.4); κάρτα εὖ Hdt. 3.150; εὖ . . πάνυ or πάνυ εὖ, Ar. Pl. 198, Pl. Men. 80b; εὖ σφόδρα Nicostr. 8, Philem. 75.4; εὖ κἀνδρικῶς, εὖ κἀνδρείως, Ar. Eq. 379 (lyr.), Th. 656; καλῶς τε καὶ εὖ (v. supr. Ι.1); εὖ τε καὶ καλῶς Pl. R. 503d.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst., τὸ εὖ the right, the good cause, τὸ δʼ εὖ νικάτω A. Ag. 121; τὸ γὰρ εὖ μετʼ ἐμοῦ Ar. Ach. 661; the Good, final cause, τὸ εὖ τεκταινόμενος ἐν πᾶσιν τοῖς γιγνομένοις Pl. Ti. 68e; τοῦ εὖ ἕνεκα Arist. Sens. 437a1, cf. eund. Metaph. 1092b26: in Art, perfection, the ideal, τὸ εὖ διὰ πολλῶν ἀριθμῶν γίνεται Polyclit. 2.

data.quote: τὸ εὖ τεκταινόμενος ἐν πᾶσιν τοῖς γιγνομένοις
τὸ εὖ διὰ πολλῶν ἀριθμῶν γίνεται

children.label: IV
children.definition: τί τῶνδʼ εὖ; A. Ch. 338 (lyr.), cf. 116; εὖ εἴη may it be well, Id. Ag. 216 (lyr.); εὐορκεῦντι μέμ μοι εὖ εἶμεν or εἴη, SIG 953.9 ( Calymna, ii B.C.), PEleph. 23.19 (iii B.C.); εὖ σοι γένοιτο well be with thee, E. Alc. 627, cf. Fr. 707.

children.label: V
children.definition: well done! to cheer on dogs, εὖ κύνες X. Cyn. 9.20; ahoy! ho! Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 20.11; cf. εὖγε.

children.label: VI
children.definition: abundance ( εὐανδρία), prosperity ( εὐδαίμων, opp. κακοδαίμων), ease ( εὔβατος, opp. δύσβατος): compounded only with Nouns and Adjs. (hence εὖ πάσχω, εὖ ποιέω are better written divisim, but εὐποιητικός implies εὐποιέω: v. ἀντευποιέω) ; εὐδοκέω is exceptional. (Replaced by καλῶς in later Gr., exc. in set phrases.)

definition: εὗ, enclit. εὑ, Ion. and Ep. for οὗ ( οὑ), gen. of reflex. Pron. of 3rd pers., Il. 20.464; for αὑτοῦ, Hdt. 3.135.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἑῷ, Trans.Am.Phil.Ass. 57.202 (Laodicea Combusta).

definition: εὖα ἐπιφημισμὸς ληναϊκὸς καὶ μυστικός, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὔαν, v. εὔας.

children.label: III
children.definition: εὐά· τράγου φωνῆς μίμημα Anon. ap. Suid.
Pl. ap. Phryn. 235 (prob. referring to R. 432d, Tht. 144b, where codd. and edd. have εὖ ἀγγέλλω).
good tidings, LXX 4 Ki. 7.9, J. AJ 18.6.10.

definition: εὐαγγελίζομαι, impf., Paus. 4.19.5: fut. part. - ιούμενος J. AJ 6.4.2, 18.6.10, Luc. Icar. 34: aor. (v. infr.):— Act., only in later Gr., LXX 1 Ki. 31.9, Apoc. 10.7, PGiss. 27.6 (ii A.D.): plpf. εὐηγγελίκειν dub. in D.C. 61.13: ( εὐάγγελος):—

children.definition: bring good news, announce them, λόγους ἀγαθοὺς φέρων εὐαγγελίσασθαί τινι Ar. Eq. 643, cf. Phryn.Com. 44, D. 18.323; τὴν εὐτοκίαν Sor. 1.70; εὐτυχίας τῇ πατρίδι Lycurg. 18; πρός σε ταῦτα Men. Georg. 83; also τινά τι J. AJ 18.6.10, Alciphr. 3.12, Hld. 2.10; εὐ. ὅτι . . Thphr. Char. 17.7; τινι ὅτι . . Luc. Philops. 31: c. acc. et inf., Plu. Mar. 22:— Act., εὐ. τὰ τῆς νίκης PGiss. l.c.; τισιν ὡς . . Polyaen. 5.7:— Pass., receive good tidings, ἐν ᾗ -ίσθη ἡ πόλις ἡμέρᾳ AJA 18.323 ( Sardes, i B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: preach or proclaim as glad tidings, τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ Ev.Luc. 4.43, etc.; εἰρήνην ὑμῖν Ep.Eph. 2.17, etc.

proclaim glad tidings, πτωχοῖς LXX Is. 61.1, cf. Ev.Luc. 4.18, etc.: c. acc., preach the glad tidings of the gospel to, τὸν λαόν ib. 3.18; κώμας τῶν Σαμαρειτῶν Act.Ap. 8.25:—so in Act., Apoc. 10.7; τινι LXX 1 Ki. 31.9:— Pass., have the gospel preached to one, Ev.Matt. 11.5, Ep.Hebr. 4.2, 6; also of the gospel, to be preached, Ev.Luc. 16.16, Ep.Gal. 1.11.

reward of good tidings, given to the messenger, εὐαγγέλιον δέ μοι ἔστω Od. 14.152; οὐ . . εὐ. τόδε τείσω ib. 166; ἀπολήψῃ τὸ εὐ. Plu. Demetr. 17: in Att. always in pl., εὐαγγέλια θύειν to make a thank-offering for good-tidings, Isoc. 7.10, Men. Pk. 415; εὐ. θύειν ἑκατὸν βοῦς τῇ θεῷ Ar. Eq. 656; ἐβουθύτει ὡς εὐ. X. HG 4.3.14; εὐαγγελίων θυσίαι Aeschin. 3.160; εὐ. στεφανοῦν, ἀναδῆσαί τινα, to crown one for good news brought, Ar. Eq. 647, Pl. 765; ἐστεφανωμένη ἐπʼ εὐαγγελίοις Plu. Sert. 11, cf. Supp.Epigr. 1.362.7 ( Samos, iv B.C.).

data.quote: εὐ. θύειν ἑκατὸν βοῦς τῇ θεῷ

children.label: II
children.definition: good tidings, good news, in pl., LXX 2 Ki. 4.10, Cic. Att. 2.3.1, 13.40.1, Inscr.Prien. 105.40 (i B.C.): sg., J. BJ 2.17.4, Luc. Asin. 26, App. BC 3.93, Sammelb. 421 (iii A.D.).
the gospel, Ep.Gal. 1.11, etc.
giver of glad tidings, epith. of Zeus, Aristid. Or. 53 ( 55). 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: μήν) month in an Asiatic calendar, Hemerolog.Flor.
bringer of good tidings: hence, evangelist, preacher of the gospel, Act. Ap. 21.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: proclaimer of oracular messages, IG 12(1).675 ( Rhodes).
bringing good news, πῦρ A. Ag. 21; ἐλπίδες ib. 262, etc.; σωτηρίων πραγμάτων εὐ. ib. 646; Φήμῃ εὐ. IG 14.1120; ῥινός Opp. H. 5.237; title of Hermes, Hsch.
brightness, clearness, alertness, [ τῆς ψυχῆς] Iamb. VP 24.107: pl., ἀγχίνοιαί τε καὶ ψυχῆς εὐάγειαι ib. 17.74: prob. cj. ib. 3.13.
to be pure, holy, E. Ba. 1008 (lyr.); αὐτὸς δʼ εὐαγέοιμι καὶ εὐαγέεσσιν ἅδοιμι Theoc. 26.30, cf. Orph. Fr. 222; εὐαγέων καὶ εὐαγέεσσι μελοίμην Call. Del. 98.

data.quote: αὐτὸς δʼ εὐαγέοιμι καὶ εὐαγέεσσιν ἅδοιμι

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be purified, IG 12(1).677 ( Rhodes).
free from pollution, pure:

guiltless, ὁ δὲ ἀποκτείνας τὸν ταῦτα ποιήσαντα . . ὅσιος ἔστω καὶ εὐ. Lex ap. And. 1.96, cf. Porph. VP 15; εὐαγεστάτων ἱππέων, v.l. for εὐγενεστάτων, D.H. 10.13; of bees, chaste (cf. Verg. G. 4.198), AP 9.404.7 ( Antiphil.).

holy, lawful, τίς οἶδεν εἰ κάτωθεν εὐαγῆ τάδε; S. Ant. 521; εὐαγές ἐστι τὸ ἀποκτεῖναι D. 9.44, cf. Arist. Fr. 538, App. BC 2.148; τοῦτο δʼ οὐκ εὐαγές μοι ἀπέβη well-omened, favourable, Pl. Ep. 312a. Adv. εὐαγέως, ἔρδειν h.Cer. 274, 369, cf. A.R. 2.699, POxy. 1203.5 (i A.D.), etc.; οὐκ εὐαγῶς Ph. 2.472: Sup. - έστατα Jul. Or. 7.230d.

undefiled: hence, lawful, ἐλέφας . . οὐκ εὐ. ἀνάθημα Pl. Lg. 956a; θυηλαί A.R. 1.1140, etc.; ὕμνοι AP 7.34 (Antip. Sid.); λύσις a solution free from defilement, S. OT 921; οὐκ εὐ. ἀπολογίαι Porph. Abst. 2.10. ( Εὐhάγης as pr. n., IG 12(9).56.118 ( Styra, v B.C.).)
Suid., cf. EM 266.3.

bright, clear, εὐᾱγέος ἠελίοιο (cf. ἁγής II) Parm. 10.2; καθαρὰ καὶ εὐαγέα, of the sun and heavenly bodies, Hp. Insomn. 89, cf. Democr. ap. Thphr. Sens. 73, 78; λευκῆς χιόνος . . εὐαγεῖς βολαί E. Ba. 662; εὐαγέστερον γίγνεσθαι, opp. σκοτωδέστερα φαίνεσθαι καὶ ἀσαφῆ, Pl. Lg. 952a; εὐαγέστατος, opp. θολερώτατος, of air, Id. Ti. 58d; χεύων ὁλκὰν εὐαγῆ Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 35.19; σὺν . . εὀαγεῖ (also εὐαγεῖ, εὐαυγεῖ) Ὑγιείᾳ Pae.Erythr. 15, al.; ὀφθαλμοί Aret. SA 2.4, Adam. 1.13.
alert, ἄνθρωποι Hp. Vict. 2.62 (v.l. γίνεται εὐαγής (sc. ἥ τε ὄψις καὶ ἡ ἀκοή), cf. εὐαγέα (v.l. εὐπαγέα) καὶ εὐήκοα ibid.).

children.label: II
children.definition: far-seen or conspicuous, πέτρα Pi. Pae.Fr. 19.25; ἕδραν παντὸς εὐαγῆ στρατοῦ a seat in full view of the army, A. Pers. 466; ἔστην θεατὴς πύργον εὐαγῆ λαβών E. Supp. 652. ( ᾱ Parm. l.c., Lyr. Alex. l.c., AP 6.204 ( Leon., s.v.l.).—Perh. fr. εὐ-ᾱυγής ( ᾰὐγή lengthd., cf. εὐᾱγορέω, εὐᾱής, etc.), as ἑᾱτοῦ fr. ἑᾱυτοῦ: εὐαυγ- is a correction in Pi. l.c., v.l. in Pae.Erythr. l.c., and may be the original spelling; cf. εὐαυγής.)
bright, φύσιν εὐ., of clouds, Ar. Nu. 276 (lyr.). ( ᾱ, which prohibits the other expl. given by Sch., = εὐκίνητος. —The sense ductile, from ἡγέομαι, is very dub.)

easy to bear in the arms, ἄχθος οὐκ εὐάγκαλον A. Pr. 352; τόξον E. Fr. 785 (Nauck ἄγκυλον) ; φόρτος, of Anchises, Ael. Fr. 148, cf. Porph. Abst. 1.45: metaph., λόγοι Them. Or. 18.219d; pleasant to embrace, Luc. Am. 25.
Πίνδον ἀνʼ εὐάγκειαν Call. Cer. 83. (Formed like Κυπρογένεια.)
with sweet glades, Pi. N. 5.46.
consisting of many or fine cloves ( ἄγλιθες), of a head of garlic, Nic. Al. 432 (cod. opt., melius εὐάγλις).
easily bought, cheap, Hsch. s.v. εὔωνον.
to have good sport, AP 6.304.8 ( Phan.), Antig.Car. ap. Ath. 7.297f: c. acc., εὐαγρεῖν ἠέρα γαῖαν ὕδωρ AP 6.12 ( Jul.).
good sport, Plb. 8.29.6, AP 6.187 ( Alph.), 9.268 (Antip. Thess.).
lucky in the chase, S. OC 1088 (lyr.), AP 6.34 ( Rhian.); affording good sport, ib. 9.555 ( Crin.); epith. of Pan, Sammelb. 4031, 4053; of Ares, BMus.Inscr. 1064 ( Egypt).
good education, ἡ Ἐπικράτους εὐ. τοῦ ἀδελφοῦ Aeschin. 2.151, cf. Simp. in Epict. p.19 D., al.

children.label: II
children.definition: easiness of being led, ψυχῆς πρὸς λόγους Pl. Def. 413b, cf. Them. Or. 13.175c: abs., docility, Arist. VV 1250b32; κουφότης καὶ εὐ. Philostr. VA 6.13.

easily led, ductile, ἐπί τι, εἴς τι, τινι πρός τι, Pl. R. 486d, X. Oec. 12.15, Arist. Pol. 1327b38; πρὸς πᾶν Plb. 11.29.9; εἰς ἀκολασίαν S.E. M. 6.34; τινι by a master, Pl. Lg. 671b; πόλις -οτέρα ὑπὸ τῶν τυχόντων Isoc. Ep. 2.15; εὐάγωγόν ἐστι πᾶς ἀνὴρ ἐρῶν Men. 352.
easily purged, -ότατος χυμός Gal. 15.78.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily managed, of the Nile, Isoc. 11.13; of horses, docile, Poll. 1.195; of the voice, easily trained, Id. 2.117; δακτύλων τὸ εὐ., of a statue, Luc. Im. 6; of land, easily cultivated, Str. 5.3.12; commodious, ἐνδιαιτήσεις Ph. 1.334.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. - γως in an accommodating spirit, Cic. Att. 13.23.3.
of successful contests, τιμά Pi. N. 10.38.

definition: εὐαδές εὔπνουν, and εὐαδής· εὐήνεμος, οἱ δὲ εὐαής, Hsch. (cf. S. Ph. 828 (lyr.)).

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐαδέα (accus. ?) dub. l. in Hp. Decent. 4 codd.
liable to wrong, And. 4.15, Luc. Tim. 32, Hipparch. ap. Stob. 4.4.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily injured, Sor. 1.47, 106, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc. 21.16, Gal. 10.542.
freshness of air, prob. in Callix. 1, cf. Ptol. Tetr. 86; fineness of weather, Plu. An seni 2.787e, Eust. 1505.19: Ion. εὐηερίη, v. εὐήρεια.
with fresh, good air, τὸ εὐ. Str. 3.2.13, cf. Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.73, Orib. 9.20.1.

cry εὐαί, in honour of Bacchus, S. Ant. 1134 (lyr.), E. Ba. 1034 (lyr.); Διονύσῳ AP 9.363.11 ( Mel.), cf. D.S. 4.3, Callistr. Stat. 2: c. acc. cogn., μελῳδὸν εὐ. χορόν Sopat. 10:— Med., Βάκχιον -ομένα E. Ba. 68 (lyr.).
well ventilated, fresh, airy, χώρῳ ἐν εὐαεῖ Hes. Op. 599 ( εὐᾰέϊ codd., Rzach).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., of a wind, favourably blowing, fair, opp. δυσαής, Hdt. 2.117, E. Hel. 1504 (lyr.); ἀνέμων εὐαέσσιν ῥοθίοις prob. in E. Fr. 773.36 (lyr.): metaph., favourable, Ὕπνε . . , εὐαὲς ἡμῖν ἔλθοις [with ᾰ] S. Ph. 828 (lyr., s.v.l.).
successful in contests, Pi. I. 6(5).3.

children.label: II
children.definition: happily won, γέρα APl. 16.363.
Ar. Lys. 1294 (lyr.), etc.; εὐαὶ σαβαῖ Eup. 84.
goodness of blood, Gal. 7.564.
easily bleeding, Gal. 19.457, Leonid. ap. Aët. 15.5, Paul.Aeg. 6.30.
full-blooded, in Comp., μόριον Gal. 17(2).423, cf. 11.290.
much-extolled, μέριμνα B. 18.11; ἵππος Antim. 25.
= foreg., Ὀρφεύς Pi. P. 4.177.
easy to be taken, χώρη Hdt. 7.130; λαγώς Poll. 5.50, cf. X. Mem. 3.1.10.
quick sensibility, vigorous capacity of sensation, Pl. Ti. 76d, Arist. PA 656a16, Stoic. 3.32, Aristeas 259, Ph. 1.104, al., Gal. UP 8.6, Iamb. Protr. 2.
have keen perceptions, Tz. H. 4.451.

definition: εὐαισθητικός, ή, όν, = sq., Gal. 16.360; δύναμις

children.definition: sensory faculty, Steph. in Gal. 1.234 D.

with quick senses or keen perceptions, περί τι Pl. Lg. 812b; ἐλέφας εὐ. ζῷον Arist. HA 630b21: Comp. - ότερος Pl. Ti. 75c; τῆς καρδίας τὴν ὑπερῴαν -οτέραν ἔχειν Plu. Aud.poet. 2.14d: Sup. ὁ ἄνθρωπος -ότατος τῶν ἄλλων ζῴων Arist. PA 660a20; τὸ εὐ., = εὐαισθησία, Gal. 10.387. Adv. - τως, ἔχειν τινός have keen perceptions of . . , Pl. Lg. 670b, cf. 661b: Comp. - οτέρως, ἔχειν περὶ ὥρας καὶ μηνῶν καὶ ἐνιαυτῶν Id. R. 527d.

data.quote: ἔχειν περὶ ὥρας καὶ μηνῶν καὶ ἐνιαυτῶν

children.label: II
children.definition: easy to perceive, Arist. Cael. 289a7 ( Comp.), Plu. Aq. 2.956f.

happy in life, of persons, E. Ion 126 (lyr.), Call. Del. 292, etc.; happy, fortunate, βίοτος A. Pers. 711, S. Tr. 81; πλοῦτος S. Fr. 592.3 (lyr.); [ Ὕπνος] Id. Ph. 829 (lyr.); πότμος E. IA 550 (lyr.).
easy to remedy, ἁμαρτάδες εὐακεστότεραι Hp. Acut. 39.
= εὐάκεστος, easy to remedy; εὐακέστερόν [ἐστι] Ruf. (?) ap. Orib. inc.4.54. Ion. Adv. εὐακέως by an easy process of healing, Aret. CA 2.2.
well-whetted, gloss on εὐήκης, Sch. Nic. Al. 411.
Ἡρακλῆς IG 14.904.
with beautiful rays, Hdn.Gr. 1.18.
easy to pretend about, Arist. Rh. 1390b21.

definition: εὐαλάκατος [ ᾰκ], ον, Aeol. for εὐηλ-, Theoc. 28.22.

children.definition: well-grown, luxuriant, φῦκος, χιλός, AP 9.325, IG 14.1389 ii 24. Ion. Adv. - έως Hp. Lex 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., fertilizing, Ἱππουκρήνη Arat. 217, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.664c: Comp. - έστερα [ὕδατα] Aet. phys. ib. 912f.
easily healed, Hp. Art. 39: Comp., ib. 68: Sup., Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.16.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., healing, Nic. Al. 326, 622.
easily changed, Gal. UP 8.6, al., Paul.Aeg. 1.50.
with beautiful groves, prob. in Str. 3.3.1.
of good meal, AP 7.736 ( Leon.).

definition: εὐαλῶς εὐχερῶς θηρώμενος, Hsch. (leg. - άλωτος vel - αλής).

children.definition: filling the threshing-floor, of Demeter, Hsch.

easy to be taken or caught, X. Cyn. 9.9, Pl. Phdr. 240a, Demetr.Com.Vet. 4; ὑπὸ πάντων διὰ κολακείας εὐ. Plu. Crass. 6; οὔτε ὑφʼ ἡδονῆς οὔτε ὑπὸ δέους εὐ. Id. Sert. 10; εὐ. εἰς δεισιδαιμονίαν, πρὸς ἡδονάς, easily led away to . . , ib. 11, Id. Mul.virt. 2.256e; εὐ. εἰς τὸ μιμεῖσθαι easily led to imitate, Alex. fort. ib. 334d: Comp. - ωτότερος Ph. 2.132, Luc. Abd. 28 ( εὐαλούστερος is corrupt in Alciphr. 2.1): Sup. - ότατος Ph. 1.458, D.C. 60.2. Adv. - τως Ph. 1.129.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily affected, Sor. 1.47; παλμῷ Gal. 7.599; but also, easily cured, ὑπὸ τῆς τέχνης Alex.Trall. 1.11.
with fine vines, E. Fr. 530.3, Str. 3.3.1, al.: epith. of Dionysus, AP 9.524.6.
with fair fillet, Μοῖσαι Pi. Dith.Oxy. 1.13.
euhan, a cry of the Bacchanals, cf. εὐοῖ, E. Tr. 326, Luc. Trag. 38.—Acc. to Hsch., an Indian name for ivy, which was sacred to Bacchus.
shooting up freely, θαλλοί Sch. Opp. H. 2.491.
easy to read aloud, Arist. Rh. 1407b11, Phld. Rh. 1.199 S.
easy to expectorate, Dsc. 3.36, Gal. 14.271.
Suid., Zonar. 926.
easy to digest, Ath. 1.26a, Diph.Siph. ap. eund. 8.356b (v.l. εὐαπόδοτον), Dsc. 2.85, Iamb. VP 3.13.
easy to call out, of the names of dogs, X. Cyn. 7.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: easy to recall, πρὸς τὸ κοινὸν συμφέρον Plu. Cim. 17; εὐ. ἑαυτὸν παρέχειν Id. TG 2. Adv. εὐανακλήτως, διακεῖσθαι πρός τινα M.Ant. 1.7.
easily cured, Aret. SD 1.7.
easy to bring back, Plu. Cohib. 2.458e; easily restored, of health, Gal. 6.297.
easy to recover, Str. 1.2.16; easily reparable, Hp. Epid. 6.4.7; easily, comfortably suspended, of fractured limbs in a sling, Id. Fract. 47 ( Sup.). Adv. - τως Id. Off.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., easily taking in, of good capacity for, ἀρετῆς Stob. 2.7.11m.
easily analysed, Simp. in Cat. 217.18. Adv. - τως ib. 212.16.

definition: εὐανάλωτος, ον, dub.l. in Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.2.2 ( εὐανάδοτος Daremb.).

children.definition: easily remembering, Hierocl. in CA 8p.432M.
credulus, Gloss.
easy to repeat in a breath, ἡ ἐν κώλοις λέξις Arist. Rh. 1409b14.
easily excited, πρὸς τοῦ πάθους Phld. Ir. p.38 W.

definition: Εὐάνασσα, ἡ, epith. of Demeter, Hsch.

children.definition: ready to turn back, cautious, Ptol. Tetr. 159.
quickly recovering, Hp. Alim. 28; ὕπνοι from which one wakes easily, Ruf. (?)ap. Orib. inc. 4.55.
easy to dissect, Gal. 2.454.
easy to upset, actiones Cic. Att. 2.14.1, cf. Heph.Astr. Praef.; easily refuted , Iamb. Protr. 21.κ.
‘shaky’, Gal. 18(1).605; but τὸ τῆς σαρκὸς εὐ. mobility, Id. UP 1.7.
well-fed, Sch. Lyc. 307.
abound in men, Aristeas 108, Str. 1.2.40, Ph. 1.641; εὐ. πολλῇ ἡλικίᾳ Plu. Cat.Ma. 26:— Med., Scymn. 252, Ocell. 4.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be in full vigour, πλήρωμα, φάλαγξ εὐ., Plu. Cam. 8, App. Syr. 37.
abundance of men, esp. of good men and true, οὐδὲ εὐ. ἐν ἄλλῃ πόλει ὁμοία X. Mem. 3.3.12, cf. D.H. 1.16, Str. 16.2.13, Plu. Per. 19.

data.quote: οὐδὲ εὐ. ἐν ἄλλῃ πόλει ὁμοία

children.label: II
children.definition: physical fitness, as a subject of a contest, Din. Fr. 16.2, IG 2(2).956.48, al.; εὐανδρίᾳ νικᾶν And. 4.42: so in pl., ἐν ταῖς εὐανδρίαις Ath. 13.565f; πληρωμάτων εὐανδρίαις by the crews being able-bodied men, Plu. Pomp. 24.
manliness, E. El. 367; ἡ δʼ εὐανδρία διδακτός Id. Supp. 913; παρασκευάζειν πρὸς εὐανδρίαν to train to manly spirit, Antig. Rex ap. D.L. 7.7.
abounding in good men and true, Σπάρτα Tyrt. 15.1; χώρα, γᾶ, Pi. P. 1.40, E. Tr. 229 (lyr.), Ar. Nu. 300 (lyr.), etc.; εὐανδροτάτη πόλις Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.209e.

children.label: II
children.definition: prosperous to men, συμφοραί A. Eu. 1031.
easy to dissolve, Dsc. 5.134.
a plant like camomile, Hp. Mul. 1.78 (v.l. βοάνθεμον).
flowery, blooming, φυά Pi. O. 1.67; ἥβη AP 7.602 ( Agath.); ἶρις ib. 4.1.9 ( Mel.).

to be flowery or blooming, Luc. VH 2.6 (dub.): metaph., to be overgrown, hypertrophied, Hp. Nat.Mul. 8 ( ἐκθέωσι Littré fr. Erot.), v.l. in Mul. 2.135; but later, to be flourishing, prosperous, BGU 1080.24 (iii A.D.).
blooming, downy, πυκάσαι τε γένυς εὐανθέϊ λάχνῃ Od. 11.320.

children.label: II
children.definition: rich in flowers, flowery, ἀγροί Thgn. 1200; κόλποι λειμώνων Ar. Ra. 373 (lyr.); τόπος Pl. Smp. 196b; decked with flowers, στόλος Pi. P. 2.62, cf. Sapph. 78; freely flowering, Thphr. HP 6.2.3.

flowered, gay-coloured, gay, bright, χρῶμα Pl. Phd. 100d, cf. Arist. Col. 792a15, 794b5 ( Comp.); θρόμβοι αἵματος Hp. Coac. 621, cf. 575; στρωμναί Ph. 1.639 ( Sup.); ἐσθής Luc. Rh.Pr. 15; βαφαί Ael. NA 16.41; πορφύρη AP 6.250 ( Antiphil.); λίθος Jul. Or. 2.51a; τὸ εὐ. τοῦ ὄρνιθος its bright colours, Ath. 9.399a; pink, flushed, σῶμα Sor. 1.100.

children.label: III
children.definition: blooming, fresh, goodly, ὄλβος Pi. I. 5(4).12; of persons, ἁλικία ib. 7(6).34, cf. O. 6.84, Ar. Nu. 1002; εὐ. ὀργά a goodly, noble temper, Pi. P. 1.89: ἐν ἅλμῃ . . εὐανθεστέρᾳ in fresher brine, Sotad.Com. 1.21: Sup. -εστάτη ἡλικία Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.120a.
taking trouble easily, Hsch. (also glossed by πειθήνιος, i.e. εὐάνιος [ᾱ], Dor. for εὐήνιος).
meet graciously, c. dat., Call. Dian. 268.

definition: εὐάντης (or εὐαντ-ής, ες, = sq., opp. δυσάντης, A.R. 4.148.

children.definition: accessible, gracious, θεός BMus.Inscr. 1012 ( Chalcedon, i B.C.); Μήτηρ θεῶν IG 3.134, Bull.Soc.Alex. 4.188 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: acceptable, ἄγρη Opp. C. 2.488, cf. H. 2.149.
correpte, Gloss. (dub. l.).

definition: εὐάντυξ, ῠγος, ὁ, ἡ, of a chariot,

children.definition: with beautiful rail, Suid., Phot. (but cf. εὐάξων).

definition: εὐάνωρ [ ᾱ], ορος, ὁ, ἡ, Dor. for εὐήνωρ. εὐαξής, v. εὐαυξής.

children.definition: valuable, considerable, PFlor. 37.7 (v/vi A.D.).
with beautiful axles, gloss on εὐάντυξ, Suid., Phot.

easy to get rid of, ἵππος ( i.e. finding a ready sale) X. Eq. 3.1; -ότερον πάθος Arist. Pr. 883a18, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib. 6.38.19, Max.Tyr. 13.3. Adv. - τως, ἔχειν to be easy to evacuate, of a position, Aen.Tact. 16.18.
affability, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.60 (pl.).
affable, courteous, τινι IG 4.1.26 ( Aegina, ii B.C.); φιλανθρωπία LXX 2 Ma. 14.9.
well-finished, perfect, Sch. E. Hipp. 362.
easy to cheat, Pl. Phdr. 263b ( Comp.); οἱ ἀγαθοὶ εὐ. Bias ap. Stob. 3.37.36, cf. Arist. Insomn. 460b9, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., cheating readily, τὸ θῆλυ -ότερον Id. HA 608b12.
easy to disembark on, νῆσος -ωτέρα Th. 4.30.
easily lost, Alex.Aphr. Quaest. 122.8, Simp. in Epict. p.52 D., in Ph. 274.29.
easily demonstrated, Ph. Bel. 62.27.
acceptable, Ptol. Tetr. 44, Sch. Il. 2.235.
easy of digestion, f.l. for εὐανάδοτος (q.v.).
easy of solution or explanation, πράγματα Str. 2.4.5, cf. S.E. M. 8.85.
ready at answering questions, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.42.
easy to expound by answers, Sor. 1.1 (s.v.l.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., in Adv. - τως, ἔχειν πρός τινας to have an easy answer . . , Artem. 4.63.
easy to roll off, Gal. UP 7.15, 10.6.
easy to excuse, Str. 10.3.1, Plu. Agis 17, Hierocl. in CA 19p.461M.
easy to be separated from, ὀστέων Hp. Mochl. 1; ἀπό τινος Id. Art. 14: abs., Arist. HA 530a6; easily uprooted, Thphr. HP 1.3.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily solved, of a question, Phld. Sign. 11, Demetr.Lac. 1055.23 F., A.D. Pron. 30.13.
easy to wash off, Sch.D.T. p.204 H.
easily evaporating, Thphr. Od. 42.
easily falling off, Thphr. CP 2.9.3.
easily flowing away, Hp. Fract. 28; too fluid, Gal. 12.389.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily slipping off, of bandages, Id. 18(2).765.
easy to extinguish, Artem. 1.74.
so as to be easily shaken off: hence, insecurely, καταλαμβάνειν Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.90.
easy to be torn from, ἀλλήλων [τὰ ᾠά] Arist. HA 550a12.
easy to wall off, blockade, Th. 6.75, X. HG 2.4.31.
easily escaping, slippery, τὸ ἐν τοῖς λόγοις εὐ. Sch. Ar. Ra. 848.
well-watered, γῆ Agath. 5.12.

definition: εὔαρ, etym. of ἔαρ, coined by Hellad. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.535 B.

children.definition: to be well pleasing, τῷ Κοινῷ τῶν Δελφῶν SIG 611.19 (ii B.C.), cf. LXX Ge. 5.22, al., D.S. 14.4: abs., Ph. 1.102; εὐαρέστησεν it seemed good, it was resolved, IG 14.757.8 ( Naples, i A.D.): — Pass., to be well pleased, satisfied, τινι with a thing, Ph. Bel. 55.23; τῇ νήσῳ, τῇ ἡγεμονίᾳ, D.S. 3.55, 20.79; θυσίαις Ep.Hebr. 13.16.
Pass., to be benefited, get relief, of patients, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.72,79.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Pass., Lysipp. 7, Apollon.Perg. Con. 1 Praef., D.H. 11.60, Hierocl. in CA 11p.442M.
individual taste, preference, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.27.6.
propitiatory, θυσίαι v.l. for ἀρεστήριος, D.H. 1.67.
being well pleased, πρὸς τὴν κοινὴν εὐ. to please the public, D.H. 10.57, cf. Hierocl. p.52 A.; ἢ διὰ φόβον ἢ διʼ εὐ. from fear or favour, J. AJ 12.6.2: pl., Ph. 1.290.

children.label: II
children.definition: satisfaction, Aq., Sm., Thd. Ex. 29.18.

children.label: III
children.definition: relief, benefit, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.71, Sor. 1.32, Philum. ap. Orib. 8.45.7.
one must be content with, τοῖς ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ πραττομένοις Ph. 2.413.
Hierocl. in CA 11p.442M.: in pl., individual tastes, predilections, Phld. Rh. 1.152S.
easily contented, διάθεσις εὐ. πρὸς πᾶν τὸ συμβαῖνον M.Ant. 9.6.

data.quote: διάθεσις εὐ. πρὸς πᾶν τὸ συμβαῖνον

children.definition: well-pleasing, acceptable, τὸ ἀγαθὸν εὐ. Cleanth. 3.6; τινι LXX Wi. 4.10, Ph. 2.69, 2 Ep.Cor. 5.9, etc.; τισι Ath.Mitt. 15.134 ( Nisyrus); παρά τινι LXX Wi. 9.10; ἐν τοῖς ἀναλώμασι Inscr.Prien. 114.15 (i B.C.): abs., ἀποδημία εὐ. Ph. 2.77; θέλημα τοῦ θεοῦ Ep.Rom. 12.2; χρῆσις pleasant, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.27.20; σύμμαχοι prob. in PHib. 1.15.26 ( Comp., iii B.C.); τὸ εὐ. Ph. 1.585. Adv. - τως, ἔργον συνετέλεσεν IG 12(8).640.10 ( Peparethus, ii B.C.): Comp. - οτέρως, διακεῖσθαί τινι X. Mem. 3.5.5 ( εὐαρεσκοτέρως codd.); -τως ἱερησάμενος SIG 708.20 ( Istropolis, ii B.C.), cf. IPE 12.94 ( Olbia); λατρεύειν τῷ θεῷ Ep.Hebr. 12.28.

children.label: II
children.definition: choice, οἶνος, πυρός, PStrassb. 1.9 (vi A.D.), PFlor. 30.30 (iv A.D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: according to taste, λαχανόσπερμον λαμβάνειν εὐ. PFay. 90.17 (iii A.D.).
easy to count, i.e. few in number, Hp. Acut. 3, Pl. Ap. 40d, Smp. 179c; τὸ πλῆθος οὐκ εὐ. ἦν J. AJ 2.15.1; ὀλίγα καὶ εὐ. Jul. Or. 3.102c.

definition: εὐαρίστως, Adv., later spelling of εὐαρέστως, IPE 12.107 ( Olbia).

children.definition: easy to govern, manageable, of a horseʼs mouth, A. Pers. 193.
with beauteous car, Θήβα S. Ant. 845 (lyr.).
victorious in the chariot-race, Pi. P. 2.5, I. 2.17.
to be well tempered or composed, Hp. Praec. 9; to be of convenient size, Ph. Bel. 53.29; suit, agree with, c. dat., Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.25.
happy adaptation, suitableness, μὴ μόνοις τοῖς λεγομένοις, ἀλλὰ καὶ ταῖς τούτων εὐ. συμπείθειν Isoc. 15.189; εὐ. ψυχῆς πρὸς τὰς ἡδονάς Pl. Def. 411e, cf. Ph. 2.79, etc.

data.quote: μὴ μόνοις τοῖς λεγομένοις, ἀλλὰ καὶ ταῖς τούτων εὐ. συμπείθειν

children.label: II
children.definition: Pl. R. 400d, Prt. 326b, etc.; εὐ. τρόπων D. 61.19; εὐ. πρὸς ἔντευξιν Plu. Pomp. 1; of political concord, κοινὸν ἀγαθὸν εὐ. τις Ecphant. ap. Stob. 4.7.64.
well-joined, harmonious, κάλαμοι E. El. 702 (lyr.); μέλος, ὄνομα, Pl. Lg. 655a, Cra. 405a.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-tempered, Hp. Epid. 2.6.1; accommodating, harmonious, πρὸς ἅπαντα τὴν ἕξιν τῆς ψυχῆς εὐ. ἔχειν Isoc. 12.32; εὐ. ἑαυτὸν ἐν πᾶσι παρέχων Pl. R. 413e: Comp. and Sup., Id. Prt. 326b, R. 412a; τὸ εὐ., = εὐαρμοστία, Ph. 1.5. Adv. - τως, ἔχειν πρός τι Isoc. 11.12, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.135; ἀπηκριβῶσθαι Ph. 1.33.

data.quote: πρὸς ἅπαντα τὴν ἕξιν τῆς ψυχῆς εὐ. ἔχειν

children.definition: rich in sheep, AP 6.108 ( Myrin.); in lambs, ὀΐς ib. 7.657.9 ( Leon.).
well-ploughed or easy to be ploughed, A.R. 2.810; ὀργάς AP 6.41 ( Agath.); αὖλαξ ib. 9.347 ( Leon.):—also εὐ-ᾰροτρίαστος, ον, EM 141.2.
well-seasoned, χοιρίον Ath. 4.165b; ἅλες Orib. Fr. 80; ὀσμή Archig. ap. Gal. 13.175.
good government, PMasp. 2iii9 (vi A.D.), EM 390.38; gloss on εὐηγεσία, Sch. Od. 19.114.
Hsch.: also aor. 1 Med. - ίσασθαι· ἀπάρξασθαι, Id.
good discipline, Lyd. Mens. 4.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. strena, Gloss.
governing well, Lvc.233.
easily governed, Arist. Oec. 1344b14.

children.label: II
children.definition: beginning well, λόγος Luc. Lex. 1; making a good beginning, of oneʼs first customer in the market, AP 6.304 ( Phan., s.v.l.).
= Lat. ovatio, Plu. Marc. 22; cf. εὐαστής II.
one who cries εὐαί, i.e. a Bacchanal, κούρη Orph. H. 49.1: as Subst., Philostr. Im. 1.19.
Adj., ὁ, ἡ, Bacchic, φωνή Nonn. D. 19.110.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εὔας, ὁ, a name of Bacchus, Hsch.
a Bacchanalian shout, in pl., E. Ba. 129, 151 (both lyr.).
the cry of εὐαί, Hermesian. 7.18, Str. 4.4.6, Plu. Marc. 22, Ant. 75 (pl.).

definition: εὐάστειρα, ἡ, fem. of εὐαστήρ, Orph. H. 51.8, 69.1.

children.definition: rich in stars, Arat. 237.

children.label: II
children.definition: fair star, of the moon, Orph. H. 9.3.
= sq. [εὐάστερος], Orph. H. 30.1, Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.4; Βάκχος AP 9.246 ( Marc.Arg.).

definition: εὐαστής, οῦ, or parox. εὐάστης, ου, ὁ, ( εὐάζω)

children.definition: one who cries εὐαί, a Bacchanal, Orph. H. 54.5, APl. 16.15, etc.
εὐ. θεός, = Βάκχος, Ath.Mitt. 27.94 ( Pergam., ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ εὐ. θρίαμβος, = Lat. ovatio, D.H. 5.47 (nisi leg. οὐαστής).
Bacchanalian, ἐπίρρημα, ἀναφώνημα, A.D. Adv. 121.21, Hsch. s.v. εὔσαμα.

definition: εὐάτριος [ ᾱ], ον, Dor. for εὐήτριος.

children.definition: bright, shining, v.l. in Pi. Pae.Fr. 19.25, v.l. in Pae.Erythr. 15, al.: Sup. - έστατος v.l. in Arist. Mu. 397a16; cf. εὐᾱγής.
illumination, Iamb. Protr. 21.κδʹ; cf. εὐάγεια.

easily elongated, elastic, Arist. HA 493a30; increased in growth, in Comp. - έστερος Id. PA 673b34; quick-growing, Thphr. CP 1.8.4: Comp., Gp. 10.57.9 ( v.l. - ότερον); tall, Suid. s.v. βλωθρή: Sup., Gal. UP 11.14. ( εὐαξ- Suid., Hsch. s.v. εὐαλδῆ, v.l. in Arist. PA l.c., Thphr. l.c. (codd. Urb., Med.), Gp. l.c., εὐαυξ- v.l. ib. 10.13.3: prob. εὐᾱξ- from εὐᾱυξ-, cf. εὐᾱγής.)
easy to disperse, Thphr. Od. 42.
softness to the touch, Heraclid.Cum. 5; -είας χάριν Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.8.3, cf. Antyll.ib. 45.2.1, Gal. 12.844.
easy to describe, Hdt. 7.63, D.C. 42.26.

definition: εὐαφήδισεν ἄφρων τις ἐν αὐταῖς ἰσχυρόν, Hsch.
