children.definition: soft, of seeds ready to germinate, Thphr. CP 2.17.10; σπλήν Aret. SD 1.14; of tumours, = εὔεικτος, Paul.Aeg. 6.3: metaph., susceptible, νοῦς Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.588e. Adv. Sup. - εστάτως, σκευαζομένη ἔμπλαστρος Aët. 16.47.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., having a gentle, delicate touch, ἀνήρ Aret. CA 2.9; τὸ εὐαφὲς τῶν δακτύλων Luc. Im. 14; σπόγγοι Paul.Aeg. 4.21: Sup. τὸ -έστατον Ph. Fr. 14 H.: metaph., εὐ. μετάβασις an easy, unforced transition, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 55. Adv. - ῶς, Ion. - έως, gently, Id. Harm. 1, Aret. CA 1.6: metaph., δεικνύναι point out gently, M.Ant. 11.18.4.

definition: εὐαφίη, ἡ, Ion. for εὐάφεια, AP 5.34 ( Rufin.), 293.16 ( Agath.).

children.definition: mild ointment, Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.314.
opportunely, Sch. S. OC 111, Ulp.ad D. 21.143, 19.188.

definition: εὐαφρόδιτος, prob. f.l. for ἐπαφρ-, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.221.
εὐβαλκής, ές, dub.sens., of a form of ἀγών, IG 5(1).267, al. ( Sparta). (Perh. for εὐϝαλκής ( ἀλκή) with secondary ϝ.)

children.definition: easy to carry or move, μηχανή Hdt. 2.125, cf. Arist. Rh. 1373a32, Pol. 1257a34; ἐλαφροὶ καὶ εὐ. Corn. ND 30; τοῖς ὠταρίοις by the ears (handles), Demoph. Sim. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-supported, Hp. Fract. 30 (dub. sens.).
accessible, passable, οὐ γὰρ εὔ. περᾶν A. Pr. 718; ποιεῖν τι εὔ. τινί Pl. Lg. 761a: Comp. - ώτερος X. HG 4.6.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: Comp., more accessible or manageable, Thphr. HP 2.6.12.
well steeped or dyed, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.44 (dub. l.); vivid, of the colours of plants, Sabin. ap. Orib. 9.17.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - βαφῶς prob. f.l. for εὐαφῶς in Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.72:—so εὐβαφία, ἡ, f.l. for εὐάφεια, ib. 87; εὐβαφῶν (σπόγγων) f.l. for εὐαφῶν, Paul.Aeg. 4.21.

definition: εὔβιος, ον, = sq. 1, Arist. HA 620a21 ( Sup.).

children.label: II
children.definition: = sq. II, Supp.Epigr. 2.530.1 ( Puteoli, ii/iii A. D.).
easily finding their food, of certain animals, Arist. HA 609b19, 615a18.

children.label: II
children.definition: leading an honest life, respectable, D.C. 52.39, prob. in Antioch Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.110: written - βίωτος in IG 5(2).491 ( Megalopolis, ii/iii A.D.).
easily hurt, Arist. GA 719a34, Gp. 9.9.10.
grow vigorously, Thphr. CP 1.20.5; germinate well, of seeds, ib. 4.7.2, cf. 4.3.3; strike readily, of cuttings, ib. 3.7.11.
growing vigorously, ib. 1.8.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., making to grow luxuriantly, ib. 2.3.3.
vigorous growth, ib. 1.20.5, al. (Sts. written - βλάστεια.)
with beautiful eyelids, Δίκη AP 14.122.
easily hit, exposed to blows, App. BC 2.79; τοῖς πολεμίοις Id. Syr. 35.
easily assisted or defended, χώρα Arist. Pol. 1327a3, cf. 21.
easily cured, Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 8 ( Comp.), Arist. Pr. 862b6.

definition: Εὔβοια, gen. ας, Ion. ης, ἡ,

children.definition: Euboea, Il. 2.535, etc.: Εὐβοίηθεν, poet. Εὐβοίη-θε, from Euboea, Call. Del. 197: Εὐβοεύς (not Εὐβοιεύς EM 389.10, and so gen. pl. Εὐβοέων SIG 419.4 ( Delphi, iii B.C.), al., but Εὐβοιέων ib. 417.4 (ibid., iii B.C.), al., where οι may be short as in βοιηθέω), έως, ὁ, acc. Εὐβοᾶ, pl. - οᾶς (in codd. often - οέας, cf. Th. 4.92) A.D. Pron. 99.22:— a Euboean, Hdt. 8.4, etc.:— Adj. Εὐβοϊκός, ή, όν, Euboean, Id. 3.89 ( v.l. - εικός), etc. (perh. trisyll. in A. Fr. 356, E. Hel. 767); - βοϊκή, ἡ, = ἀκτῆ, Ps.- Dsc. 4.173; - κόν, τό, sweet chestnut, Thphr. HP 1.11.3, 4.5.4: masc. Εὐβοΐτης, ου, ὁ, Str. 10.1.14; fem. Εὐβοΐς, gen. Εὐβοΐδος, Hdt. 3.89, D.S. 12.11; Εὐβοΐς, ἡ, = Εὐβοϊκόν, D.Chr. 7.74; contr. forms Εὐβοῖδα, etc., S. Tr. 74, E. Heracl. 83 (lyr.), El. 442 (lyr.), A. Fr. 30, Ion Trag. 18; lengthd. Εὐβοιΐς S. Tr. 237, 401, Fr. 255.
make a good throw with the dice, Luc. Am. 16.

throwing luckily (with the dice), Μίδας ἐν κύβοισιν εὐβολώτατος Eub. 58, cf. Poll. 9.94, Suid. s.v. Μίδας: generally, lucky, ἄγρη Opp. H. 3.71, Hld. 5.18. Adv., ἦν γὰρ -λως ἔχων he was in luck, cj. Pors. for εὐβούλως, A. Ch. 696: Comp., πεσσοὶ -ώτερον πίπτοντες Aristaenet. 1.23.
good pasture, ἡ χώρα ἔχει πολλὴν εὐ. Arist. HA 522b22, cf. 575b32; good culture, Thphr. HP 1.11.4.
good living, Arist. GA 726a6.
good condition, τοῦ σώματος ib. 774b25.

abundance, plenty, ἐν εὐ. ὑπάρχειν Inscr.Prien. 108.48 (ii B. C.); ἔθυον -βοσίαν γενέσθαι St.Byz. s.v. Ἀζανοί; ἵνα ὁ δῆμος ἐν εὐβοσίᾳ διαγένηται Supp.Epigr. 1.366.49 ( Samos, iii B.C.); ἐξ ἁλός AP 11.199 ( Leon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Zeitschr.f. Numism. 7.223 (coin of Hierapolis); Σεβαστὴ Εὐ., of a deified Empress, IGRom. 4.654 ( Acmonia): also spelt Εὐποσία (q. v.):—hence Εὐβοσιάρχης, ου, ὁ, official title (like Εὐθηνιάρχης), Papers of Amer. School 3 No.317; cf. Εὐποσιάρχης.
of beautiful locks, αἴγλη AP 5.250 ( Iren.), cf. Poll. 2.27.
furnish good pasture, Str. 11.3.2.
abounding in pasture, Od. 15.406 (or, with fine oxen, cf. βοτόν ( Addenda)); τοῖς ζῴοις πᾶσιν εὔβοτον Pl. Criti. 111a, cf. Ph. 1.669, Plu. Cam. 16: Sup., Scymn. 607, prob. in E. Fr. 1083.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-fed, thriving, ἀμνός Theoc. 5.24.
rich in grapes, S. Ph. 548, AP 9.668.9 ( Marian.): εὐβότρυος, ον, f.l. in Anacreont. 4.17.
he of good counsel, epith. of Zeus, D.S. 5.72; of Dionysus, Orph. H. 30.6: acc. εὐβουλῆ Plu. QConv. 2.714c: Εὐ. alone, = Πλούτων, Nic. Al. 14, Orph. Fr. 237, Hsch.
good counsel, soundness of judgement, prudence, A. Pr. 1035, 1038, S. Ant. 1050, Th. 1.78, Isoc. 9.46, Arist. EN 1142b6, etc.; περί τινος Pl. Prt. 318e: pl., αἱ τῶν προγόνων εὐ. Aeschin. 2.75.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pythag. name for three, Theol.Ar. 14.

well-advised, prudent, Thgn. 329, Hdt. 8.110, Pi. O. 13.8, B. 14.37, Th. 1.84, Pl. R. 428b, Arist. EN 1141b13: Comp., Ar. Pax 689: Sup., And. 1.140. Adv. - λως (v. εὔβολος): Comp. - ότερον D.C. 43.16: Sup. - ότατα Gp. 5.16.1.
well steeped or soaked, Nic. Al. 298.
laden with fine yarn, σπάθαι AP 6.288.7 ( Leon.).
well-noosed, well-knit, ἅμμα AP 6.179 ( Arch.).
good to eat, Str. 17.1.51; πρὸς ξηροφαγίαν Ath. 3.113b.
Euph. 128; said to be from a Messapian word, EM 389.24.
with beautiful hide or skin, Sch. A.R. 3.1299.
fertile (v. sub εὔπωλος).
easy to plough, Eust. 385.36, 1431.53.
yielding much or good milk, αἴξ Alciphr. 3.21; τροφός Orib. Eup. 1.1 ( Sup.); νομή Gal. 19.121: heterocl. nom. pl. εὐγάλακτες, = εὔτροφοι, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐγάλακτον, τό, a plant, = γλαύξ, Plin. HN 27.82.
very calm, Lyc. 20. Adv. - νως Sch. A.R. 4.1776.
marry happily, Heph.Astr. 1.1.
happy marriage, ib. 1.20, Paul.Al. M. 3, Poll. 9.160.
happily married, of persons, Heph.Astr. 1.1, Paul.Al. N. 4, Nonn. D. 1.27; also εὐνή, ὕδωρ, Id. 13.352, 20.144.

well, rightly, in replies confirming or approving what has been said: as σοὶ γὰρ χαρίζομαι. Answ. εὖγε σὺ ποιῶν Pl. R. 351c; εὖγʼ, εὖγε ποιήσαντες Ar. Pax 285; εὖγε, εὖγε, ὦ κύνες, ἕπεσθε X. Cyn. 6.19: iron., εὖ γοῦν θίγοις ἂν χερνίβων E. Or. 1602; εὖγε μέντἂν διετέθην Ar. Av. 1692.
good! well said! well done! Pl. Grg. 494c, al.; doubled εὖγʼ, εὖγε Ar. Eq. 470; εὖγʼ, εὖγε, νὴ Δἴ, εὖγε Id. Ec. 213; εὖγʼ, ὅτι ἐπείσθης Id. Nu. 866: c. gen., εὖγε τῆς προαιρέσεως Luc. Vit.Auct. 8.
of or with good soil, Thphr. HP 4.11.1, D.S. 5.40, Dsc. 1.64; εὔγειος (sc. γῆ or χώρα), ἡ, fertile land, Thphr. CP 5.13.2 (pl.), Gp. 2.21.1; cf. εὔγεως.

children.label: II
children.definition: ψυχή Ph. 1.651.

nobility of birth, A. Pers. 442, E. Fr. 53, al., Isoc. 3.42, Arist. Rh. 1390b16, etc.; ἐμῶν εὐ. παίδων, = ἐμοὶ εὐγενεῖς παῖδες, E. Tr. 583 (lyr.): pl., Pl. Euthd. 279b, R. 618d; pure breeding, of animals, Onos. 1.21.
nobleness of mind, Plu. Dem. 24, Ant. 86, Ael. VH 12.1, D.Chr. 52.16, etc.
excellence, ἡ ἐν τοῖς σώμασιν εὐ. Plu. Rom. 6, cf. Gal. UP 10.6; of materials, χαλκοῦ Philostr. VA 3.54: generally, excellence, Lib. Or. 49.27.
elevation, nobility, Longin. 34.2; ποιημάτων D.H. Comp. 18.
ἡ εὐ. σου PGen. 1.50.14 (iv A.D.).

definition: εὐγένειος, Ep. ἠϋγέν-, ον, ( γένειον) of a lion,

children.definition: well-maned, λέων . . ἠϋγένειος Od. 4.456; λίς Il. 15.275; of Pan, well-bearded, h.Hom. 19.39; of men, Pl. Euthphr. 2b, Luc. Icar. 10.

definition: εὐγενέτης, ου, Dor. - έτας, ὁ, = sq., used by E. in lyr., Ion 1060, al., cf. Tim. Pers. 219, AP 12.195 ( Strat.):—fem. εὐγεν-έτειρα, ib. 9.788, IG 14.192 ( Syracuse); also εὐγεν-έτις, prob. in IG 5(1).259 ( Sparta).
εὐγενής, ές, in Hom. εὐηγενής (q.v.), and in h.Ven. 94 ἠϋγενής: ( γένος):—

children.definition: well-born, A. Pers. 704 (troch.), S. OC 728, etc.; εὐ. δόμος E. Ion 1540; τὸ μὲν ἐστίχθαι εὐγενὲς κέκριται being tattooed is esteemed a mark of nobility, Hdt. 5.6.
noble-minded, generous (more prop. γενναῖος, cf. Arist. Rh. 1390b22), S. Ant. 38, Ph. 874, etc.; διαφέρει φύσις γενναίου σκύλακος . . νεανίσκου εὐ. Pl. R. 375a.

high-bred, ἵππος Thgn. 184, S. El. 25; λέων A. Ag. 1259; ὄρνιθες Plb. 1.58.7; of plants, of a good sort, Ael. VH 2.14; ῥόαι Eriph. 2.11; πυροί Gal. 11.120; βλαστοί Gp. 5.37.2: so in Comp., Eub. 44; φλέβες καὶ ἶνες Thphr. HP 5.1.7 (s.v.l., cf. εὐτενής) ; χαλκός S. Fr. 864 (v.l.): metaph., of a wife, ὥσπερ εὐγενῆ χώραν ἐντεκνώσασθαι παρασχεῖν Plu. Cat.Mi. 25.
noble, δέρη, πρόσωπον, E. Hel. 136, Med. 1072; of style, τὸ εὐ. τῆς λέξεως Ael. NA Epil.; εὐ. ῥυθμοί D.H. Comp. 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - νῶς nobly, bravely, κατθανοῦμεν E. Cyc. 201, cf. Tr. 727; εὐτυχεῖν Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7f.
E. HF 696 (lyr.), AP 7.337.6; eugenia, a kind of vine, Plin. HN 14.25.
ennoble, πόλιν Philem. 180, cf. Lib. Eth. 17.4.

definition: εὐγένιος εὐγενής, καὶ εἶδος ἀμπέλου, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐγέν-ιον, τό, name of a kind of laurel, Gp. 11.3.4.

definition: εὐγενίς, ίδος, fem. of εὐγενής, J. AJ 7.3.3, CIG 3200 ( Smyrna), Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).159; = Lat. Matrona, Lyd. Mens. 3.22, cf. Hdn.Gr. 1.95.

children.definition: easy to bridge over, τόπος Plb. 3.66.5.
easy to cultivate, Sch. S. Ant. 569:—also εὐγέωργ-ος, ον, Scyl. 24.
Str. 7.4.6, Plu. Sull. 16, Ael. NA 5.56, App. BC 4.102 codd.
joyous, cheerful, E. HF 793 (lyr.).

definition: εὐγήθητος, Dor. εὐγάθ-, ον, = foreg., E. IT 212 (lyr.).

children.definition: grow old happily, Stoic. 3.156.
green old age, Arist. Rh. 1361b26, Stoic. 3.24, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.111b, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).167; χλόης Ph. 2.163.
sweet-sounding, ἀοιδά Ar. Ra. 213 (lyr.), cf. Opp. H. 5.617.
enjoying a green old age, Arist. Rh. 1361b28, Call. Epigr. 41.6, Epigr.Gr. 223.2 ( Milet.), Ph. 1.515, al.: nom. pl. εὔγηροι Hp. Vict. 1.32, Arist. HA 615a33: neut. εὔγηρα Hp. Art. 58.

definition: εὐγλάγετος [ ᾰ], ον, = sq., Luc. Trag. 110.
εὐγλαγής, ές, Nic. Th. 617; and εὔγλᾰγος, ον, Lyc. 307:—

children.definition: abounding in milk: metapl. dat. εὔγλαγι AP 9.744 ( Leon.).
bright-eyed, of wild beasts or fish, Lyc. 597, Opp. C. 3.97, Marc.Sid. 59.
well-carved, μέταλλον AP 7.363:—also εὐγλύφᾰνος [ ῠ], ον, Nonn. D. 34.228; εὐγλῠφής, ές, κάλαμοι AP 6.63.4 ( Damoch.).
glibness of tongue, fluency of speech, E. Fr. 206.4, Ar. Eq. 837, Ps.- Ptol. Centil. 38, Iamb. Protr. 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: sweetness of song, Ael. NA 17.23.

definition: εὔγλωσσος, Att. εὐγλωττος, ον, Cret. εὔγλωθος GDI 5112 ( Phaestos, iii/ii B.C.):—

children.definition: good of tongue, eloquent, A. Supp. 775: τὸ Νεστόρειον εὔ. μέλος E. Fr. 899.1; glib of tongue, voluble, Ar. Nu. 445 (anap.).
sweet-sounding, of the Attic dialect, AP 9.188, cf. Gal. 8.586; τὸ εὔ. that which is pleasant to the ear, D.H. Comp. 1.
GDI l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., loosing the tongue, making eloquent, οἶνος AP 9.403 ( Maec.).
Thom.Mag. p.160 R.
make sweet-voiced, ὁπόσα -ίζοι τοὺς χαραδριούς Philostr. VA 6.36.
keen-pointed, Opp. H. 5.439, Q.S. 8.406.
boast, boasting, κενὰ εὔγματα εἰπών Od. 22.249.

children.label: II
children.definition: prayers, wishes, A. Pr. 584 (lyr.), Th. 267, Ch. 463 (lyr.), S. Ant. 1185, Ar. Th. 354 (lyr.), Call. Lav.Pall. 139.
to be prayed for, prob. in Hsch., Phot.
well-bent, well-twisted, κληῗσιν ἐϋγνάμπτοις Od. 18.294; χαλινοί Opp. H. 5.498; περόναι A.R. 3.833; ἄγκυρα Orph. A. 498, etc. εὔγναπτοις· καλῶς κατεσκευασμένοις, Hsch. ( v.l. in Od. 18.294).
Philox. 1.
have good sense or feeling, show a reasonable or conciliatory spirit, Arist. Rh.Al. 1420a16, Epicur. Sent.Vat. 62, Plu. Num. 12, etc.; opp. κακοδαιμονᾶν, Id. Luc. 4; πρὸς τοὺς ἐχθρούς D.S. 13.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: reward, repay, τοὺς ἱερέας Lib. Decl. 34.26, cf. PAmh. 2.142.17 (iv A.D.); εὐ. τὴν ἀντίδοσιν make a return gift in token of gratitude, Him. Or. 8.7.
considerateness, courtesy, Aeschin. 3.170, Procl. in Prm. p.551 S.; a reasonable spirit, Arist. MM 1198b34, Anon. Hist.Alex.Magn. p.825 (11.5) J., v.l. in Luc. JConf. 7.
prudence, Plu. Them. 7, etc.

of good feeling, considerate, reasonable, And. 2.6 ( Comp.), X. Mem. 2.8.6; φιλάνθρωπος καὶ εὐ. ψυχή Aeschin. 1.137; τὸ μὲν κρῖναι τοῦ εὐγνώμονος, τὸ δὲ δὴ πράττειν κατὰ τὴν κρίσιν τοῦ ἐπιεικοῦς Arist. MM 1199a2; πολέμιοι -έστεροι Plb. 2.57.8; ψεῦδος -έστερον Luc. VH 1.4: metaph., of a game, εὔ. εἰς τὰς ἄλλας πράξεις not interfering with them, Gal. Parv.Pil. 2; παθεῖν εὐγνώμονα to be indulgently treated, D.S. 13.23: Sup., ὡς -εστάτων τυγχάνειν D. Ep. 3.45.

data.quote: τὸ μὲν κρῖναι τοῦ εὐγνώμονος, τὸ δὲ δὴ πράττειν κατὰ τὴν κρίσιν τοῦ ἐπιεικοῦς

children.definition: sensible, prudent, Aeschin. 3.170, etc.; εὐ. ὁ μὴ λυπεόμενος ἐφʼ οἷσιν οὐκ ἔχει, ἀλλὰ χαίρων ἐφʼ οἷσιν ἔχει Democr. 231; τὸ λέγειν πρὸς μὴ παρόντας οὐκ εὔ. φαίνεται Plu. Def.orac. 2.420e.

data.quote: εὐ. ὁ μὴ λυπεόμενος ἐφʼ οἷσιν οὐκ ἔχει, ἀλλὰ χαίρων ἐφʼ οἷσιν ἔχει
τὸ λέγειν πρὸς μὴ παρόντας οὐκ εὔ. φαίνεται

children.definition: εὔγνωμον τὸ πόνημα is an offering of gratitude, APl. 16.41 ( Agath.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - νως considerately, kindly, τοῖς πλήθεσι προσφέρεσθαι D.S. 19.9, cf. Plu. Ant. 63; reasonably, BGU 1011.16 (ii B.C.), Luc. Tox. 5.
gratefully, Plu. Sull. 10, Ael. NA 2.8.
prudently, χρῆσθαι ἑαυτῷ X. Ages. 2.25.
well-known, familiar, E. Or. [1394], Lys. 17.4, Pl. Sph. 218e; opp. ἄγνωστος, Epicur. Nat. 28.5.

easy to discern, S. Aj. 704 (lyr., with v.l. - γνωτος) ; τὰ εὔ. καὶ εὐμαθῆ X. Oec. 20.14: Sup., Arr. Tact. 2.1; εὔγνωστον . . πότερος ἡμῶν ἐσθʼ ὁ πονηρός D. 29.1; ὅτι . . Lys. 17.4. Adv. - τως, κρίνειν Theo Sm. p.65 H.

data.quote: εὔγνωστον . . πότερος ἡμῶν ἐσθʼ ὁ πονηρός

children.definition: well-nailed, well-fastened, πύλαι E. IT 1286:—also εὐγόμφωτος, ον, Opp. H. 1.58.
to be fruitful, of flocks, Thphr. CP 1.14.1.
fruitfulness, Pl. R. 546a, X. Lac. 1.6, Ph. 2.390, etc.; opp. ἀγονία, Iamb. Comm. Math. 15.
productive, v.l. in E. Hec. 581 ( Sup.); τὸ εὔγονον productive power, J. BJ 4.8.3 codd. (sed leg. εὔτονον).
calligraphy, Gal. 14.587.
a good writer, Heph.Astr. 1.1.
good design, of figures in tapestry, Callix. 2.

well-designed, γραφαί D.H. Is. 4; well-drawn, Luc. JTr. 33; of graceful contour, εὔ. τῇ συστάσει, of a person, Str. 4.5.2; ὀφρύων τὸ εὔ. their fine lines, Luc. Im. 6. Adv. - γράμμως, of architecture, Lyd. Mag. 3.70.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-defined, περίοδοι D.H. Dem. 40; so τὸ εὔ. Id. Comp. 23.

children.label: III
children.definition: a good writer, Man. 5.245.
well-painted, AP 6.221 ( Leon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., writing well, κάλαμος ib. 6.66.6 ( Paul.Sil.), cf. 65.10 ( Id.).
skill in painting, Epigr.Gr. 841 ( Thrace, ii A.D.).
well arched or rounded, Tryph. 537, Nonn. D. 13.68 codd. ( εὐρυάλω Ludwich).
with fine limbs, stalwart, νέοι B. 10.10.
tortuous ( = γυρός, q.v.), πάλη APl. 16.25 ( Phil.).
regularity of angles, prob. cj. in E. Ion 1137.
with regular angles, X. Oec. 4.21, Arist. Pr. 912b15; with perfect angles, four square, of blocks, IG 2(2).1666 A64, etc.; right-angled, Gal. 18(2).856.
beautifully wrought, νᾶα B. 16.88; ναόν Id. Fr. 11.3.

definition: εὐδαιμονέω, pf. εὐδαιμόνηκα Arist. Metaph. 1048b26: ( εὐδαίμων):—

children.definition: to be prosperous, well off, Hdt. 1.170, Th. 8.24, etc.; τι in respect to . . , Hdt. 2.177, S. Ant. 506, etc.; οὔτις ἀνδρῶν εἰς ἅπαντʼ εὐ. E. Fr. 45; ἔν τινι Luc. DMort. 29[24].3; εὐδαιμονοίης E. El. 231, Ph. 1086: dual, εὐδαιμονοῖτον Id. Med. 1073; parodied by Ar. Ach. 446, 457.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be truly happy, εὐδαιμονοῦσιν ἄνθρωποι ὀρθοσύνῃ καὶ πολυφροσύνῃ Democr. 40, cf. Arist. Pol. 1339b19, Diog.Oen. 25, etc.
piece of good luck, Luc. Im. 22, Stoic. 3.136 (pl.).
possession of εὐδαιμονία, Eustr. in EN 91.27.

prosperity, good fortune, opulence, h.Hom. 11.5, Pi. N. 7.56, Hdt. 1.5, 32, Hp. Ep. 11 (v.l.), etc.; χρημάτων προσόδῳ καὶ τῇ ἄλλῃ εὐ. Th. 2.97; of countries, Hdt. 5.28, 7.220, etc.; μοῖρʼ εὐδαιμονίας Pi. P. 3.84: pl., E. IA 591 (anap.), Pl. Phd. 115d.
true, full happiness, εὐ. οὐκ ἐν βοσκήμασιν οἰκεῖ οὐδʼ ἐν χρυσῷ Democr. 171; εὐ. ψυχῆς, opp. κακοδαιμονίη, Id. 170, cf. Pl. Def. 412d, Arist. EN 1095a18, Zeno Stoic. 1.46, etc.

data.quote: εὐ. οὐκ ἐν βοσκήμασιν οἰκεῖ οὐδʼ ἐν χρυσῷ

children.label: b
children.definition: SIG 985.8 ( Philadelphia).

call or account happy, εὐδαιμόνιζε παῖδα σήν E. Tr. 268, cf. X. Mem. 2.7.7, Arist. EN 1096a2, etc.; τὴν πόλιν Isoc. 8.83: c. gen. rei, οὐ . . μοίρας εὐδαιμονίσαι πρώτης for his eminent fortune, S. OC 144, cf. Pl. R. 516c, al.; αὑτὸν εὐδαιμονιεῖ τῆς περιουσίας D. 21.109, cf. 19.67; εὐ. τινὰ ὑπέρ τινος X. An. 1.7.3 (s.v.l.); ἐπί τινι D. 18.260; διά τι Luc. Nigr. 23:— Pass., διά τι Pl. R. 465d, al.
tending or conducive to happiness, Arist. EN 1176b16, Rh. 1367b13; τὰ εὐ. the constituents thereof, X. Mem. 4.2.34; τελετὴ καλή τε καὶ εὐ. Pl. Phdr. 253c.

likely to be happy, Ar. Ec. 1134, Arist. EN 1099b3; οἱ εὐ. philosophers who make happiness the chief good, D.L. 1.17; esp. of Anaxarchus, Clearch. 14; so also εὐ. αἵρεσις Gal. Phil.Hist. 4. Adv. - κῶς, πράττειν, διάγειν, Ar. Pax 856 (lyr.), X. HG 3.2.9.
that which is thought to be a happiness, Pl. Ep. 354c.

children.label: II
children.definition: congratulation, App. BC 4.16.
thinking or calling happy, predication of happiness, Arist. Rh. 1367b34, EN 1127b18, Plu. Pel. 34, etc.: pl., ὕμνοι καὶ εὐ. Ph. 1.312.al.
one must pronounce happy, Arist. EN 1100a10.
έος, α, ον, to be called happy, Arr. An. 1.12.2.
Archyt. ap. Stob. 3.1.112, 114, Perict. ib. 4.28.19, X.Eph. 1.16.

blessed with a good genius: hence, fortunate, τάων εὐδαίμων τε καὶ ὄλβιος happy in respect to them (the days), Hes. Op. 826; εὐ. καὶ ὄλβιος Thgn. 1013; εὐ. καὶ ὑμνητός Pi. P. 10.22: freq. in Trag., A. Pr. 647, Pers. 768, S. Ant. 582, etc.: c. gen. rei, happy in or on account of . . , Hes. l.c.; εὐ. τοῦ τρόπου Pl. Phd. 58e; ironically, εὐ. εἶ, ὅτι οἴει . . Id. R. 422e; τὸ εὔδαιμον, = εὐδαιμονία, Th. 2.43. Adv. -μόνως E. Or. 601, Ar. Pl. 802, Arist. Pol. 1281a2, etc.: Comp. - έστερον, διάγοντες X. An. 3.1.43: Sup., πόλις -έστατα διάξει Pl. Lg. 710b.

wealthy, οἱ εὐδαίμονες αὐτῶν Hdt. 1.133, cf. 196, 5.8, Th. 1.6, etc.; ἐν πολλοῖς χρήμασιν εὐδαίμονες ὄντες Lys. 32.17; οἱ πλούσιοι καὶ εὐ. Pl. R. 406c; οἰκία μεγάλη τε καὶ εὐ. Id. Prt. 316b; αἱ Ἀθῆναι μεγάλαι τε καὶ εὐδαίμονες Hdt. 8.111; Εὐβοίῃ, νήσῳ μεγάλῃ τε καὶ εὐ. Id. 5.31; Κυράνα Pi. P. 4.276, etc.; πόλις εὐ. Gorg. Fr. 10 D.; Ἀραβία εὐ. Peripl. M. Rubr. 26; γῆ ἀρόσαι οὐκ εὐ. Philostr. Im. 2.24; opp. εὐτυχής, ὄλβου δʼ ἐπιρρυέντος εὐτυχέστερος ἄλλου γένοιτʼ ἂν ἄλλος, εὐδαίμων δʼ ἂν οὔ E. Med. 1230.

data.quote: αἱ Ἀθῆναι μεγάλαι τε καὶ εὐδαίμονες
Εὐβοίῃ, νήσῳ μεγάλῃ τε καὶ εὐ.
εὐτυχής, ὄλβου δʼ ἐπιρρυέντος εὐτυχέστερος ἄλλου γένοιτʼ ἂν ἄλλος, εὐδαίμων δʼ ἂν οὔ

children.definition: truly happy, βίος Pl. Phlb. 11d; ὁ εὖ ζῶν μακάριός τε καὶ εὐ. Id. R. 354a, cf. 580b ( Sup.), Arist. EN 1098b21, etc.
tearful, lamentable, A. Ch. 181.
with beautiful fingers, Alciphr. 3.67.

definition: Εὐδαλαγῖνες αἱ Χάριτες, Hsch. εὐδάμνας· εὐδάμαστος,

children.definition: easily subdued, Id.
Storm-stiller, a hero worshipped at Eleusis, Arr. An. 3.16.8; = ἄγγελος, Hsch.: also in pl., Εὑδανέμων βωμός, at Athens, Arr. l.c., cf. D.H. Din. 11. ( Εὐδ. codd. Arr.)

definition: εὑδάνει, prob. f.l. for ἐνδαύει, Lyc. 1354.
εὔδαος, ον, dub. sens. in Sammelb. 5199.2.

children.definition: lavish of expense, liberal, ἐλευθεριότης εὐ. εἰς τὰ καλά Arist. VV 1250a13; τὸ εὐ. Plu. Sol. 3: Sup., D.C. 44.39.

children.label: II
children.definition: of moderate expense, cheap, D.H. 2.23, D.C. 52.30, Porph. Abst. 2.14.

definition: εὐδαρκής εὐόφθαλμος, Hsch. (prob. f.l. for εὐδρακής or εὐδερκής).

children.definition: clear, distinct, Hom. (only in Od.), usu. of Ithaca, 2.167, 9.21, etc.: generally, ἦ πού τις νήσων εὐδείελος 13.234; far-seen, Κρόνιον Pi. O. 1.111; ἄστυ Orac. ap. Eus. PE 6.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: open to the sun, sunny, χθὼν Ἰαολκοῦ Pi. P. 4.76; Κρίση h.Ap. 438; ὅσσα φύει εὐ. αἶα Euph. 50. (In signf. I perh. fr. δέελος (dub. l.), δῆλος ( *δεᾰλος?): the alternative expl. from δείλη (cf. supr. ΙΙ) given by ancient Gramm., e.g. Apollon. Lex. and Str. 9.2.41, does not suit signf. I, but suits the forms.)

definition: εὐδεινός, ή, όν, later contr. of εὐδιεινός, Orph. H. 22.5 codd.: Comp. - ότερος An.Ox. 2.207; also εὐδινή ( v.l. - διεινή) Str. 6.3.9, cf. OGI 194.22 ( Egypt, i B.C.), Hsch.

children.definition: feast offered to departed souls, Harmod. 1; cf. sq. [εὔδειπνος] II.
with goodly feasts, δαῖτες εὔ. well-appointed, sumptuous feasts, E. Med. 200 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: παρʼ εὐδείπνοις ἔσῃ ἄτιμος ἐμπύροισι κνισωτοῖς χθονός A. Ch. 484; taken by some Gramm. as applied to the festival itself, Hsch., Phot., EM 42.3.

data.quote: παρʼ εὐδείπνοις ἔσῃ ἄτιμος ἐμπύροισι κνισωτοῖς χθονός

children.definition: capacious, σῶμα IG ΙΙ(4).1247 ( Delos, iii/ii B.C.).
well-wooded, abounding in fair trees, ἄλσος Pi. O. 8.9; μάτηρ (sc. Γαῖα) Id. P. 4.74; τέμενος Simon. 13; χόρτοι E. IT 134 (lyr.), etc.: also in Prose, Hp. Aër. 12 ( Sup.), Str. 2.3.4, Ph. 2.117.
seeing brightly, bright-eyed, Max. 151, 263.
with good, stout hide, Sch. A.R. 2.125.

definition: εὐδές (post εὐετηρία) · εὔυπνον, εὐήνεμον, Hsch. (fort. εὐαές).

children.definition: well-tanned, δέρματα Hp. Art. 30 ( Sup.), cf. Gal. 18(1).436.

quite clear, abundantly manifest, A. Pers. 1009 (lyr.), etc.; εὔ. [ἐστὶ] κελεύων may be seen bidding . . , Ar. Ach. 1130 (sed cod. R ἔνδηλος) ; ῥυθμός easily distinguishable, Arist. Pr. 882b9; εὔ. γράμματα plainly legible, POxy. 1100.3 (iii A.D.); εὔδηλόν [ἐστιν] ὅτι . . Pl. Plt. 308d; φιλόσοφός τις εἶ—εὔδηλον Alex. 135.11; ἐν εὐδήλῳ [ἐστί] Hp. de Arte 9. Adv. - λως Plu. Thes. 3.

fair weather, εὐδία ἐκ χειμῶνος Pi. I. 7(6).38, cf. Antipho 2.2.1, Hp. Insomn. 89; ἐν εὐδίᾳ χειμῶνα ποιεῖν X. HG 2.4.14; ὅταν εὐ. γένηται Arist. HA 551a3; εὐδίας (gen.) in fine weather, ib. 597b13: pl., ἔν γε χειμῶσιν καὶ ἐν εὐδίαις Pl. Lg. 961e; εὐδιῶν οὐσῶν Arist. HA 626a4.

data.quote: ἔν γε χειμῶσιν καὶ ἐν εὐδίαις

children.definition: tranquillity, peace, Pi. O. 1.98, P. 5.10, A. Th. 795, X. An. 5.8.20; τὴν Αἴγυπτον εἰς εὐδίαν ἀγαγεῖν OGI 90.11 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.), cf. Herod. 1.28; εὐ. καὶ διαγωγὴ ἄλυπος Polystr. p.17 W.; of the mind, Protag. 9; σαρκὸς εὐ. good condition of . . , Plu. Sanit. 2.126c; εἰς ἔμʼ εὐδίαν ἔχων being at ease so far as I am concerned, S. Ichn. 346. [On the prosody, v. εὔδιος.]
easy to cross, ποταμός X. HG 4.2.11, Colot. ap. Plu. Col. 2.1117d, cf. Polyaen. 2.2.1.
Arist. EE 1237b23, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.77, S.E. M. 3.160, Ptol. Tetr. 2: Sup., Eus. Mynd.47.
readily talked about, Ptol. Tetr. 172.
easy to misrepresent, Pl. Lg. 944b; εὐδιάβολα τὰ τοιαῦτα πρὸς τοὺς πολλούς Id. Euthphr. 3b. Adv. - λως, ἔχειν D. 61.17.

data.quote: εὐδιάβολα τὰ τοιαῦτα πρὸς τοὺς πολλούς

children.definition: easy to distinguish, Gal. 14.63 ( Sup.), Nicom. Harm. 2.
cheerful, Dsc. 4.60 ( Comp.); pleasant, ἀνάπαυλαι Ph. 1.52, etc.
calm, still, χειμῶνας Ph. 2.567 (metaph.):—in Med., = εὐδιάω, βίος ἀσαλεύτῳ ἡσυχίᾳ εὐδιαζόμενος Pl. Ax. 370d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., to be calm, εὐδιαζούσας ἡμέρας Antig. Mir. 150.
well-arranged. Adv. - τως J. BJ 3.5.2.
easily affected, ὑπὸ τῶν ἔξωθεν A.D. Synt. 291.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-disposed, of persons. Adv. - τως, = εὐγνωμόνως, Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: easy to dispose of (in marriage), Id. s.v. οὐκ εὐ.; also of arguments or objections, Them. in APo. 62.33.
easily crushed, Phlp. in de An. 360.15.
hole in a ship, for letting off the bilge-water, Plu. QConv. 2.699f, Poll. 1.92, Hsch., Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: εὐδίαιον, τό, the end of a clyster-pipe, Paul. ex Fest. p.69 L.; εὔδιον Poll. 4.181.
Hsch.
Id.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adj., εὐδιαῖος, α, ον, caught in fair weather, τριγόλας Sophr. 67.
easy to divide, Arist. Ph. 215b11 ( Comp.); easy to tear, destroy, Thphr. HP 7.13.1, Arist. PA 654a30, etc.; easy to take to pieces, of a machine, Ph. Bel. 56.35.

definition: εὐδιαίτερος, α, ον, irreg. Comp. of εὔδιος (q. v.).

children.definition: easy to decide, Str. 8.1.1, Gal. 2.881.
living temperately, opp. πολυδάπανος, X. Ap. 19, cf. Poll. 6.27, etc.
easy to convey through or across, Hsch. s.v. ἀγχίπους.
serving well, Hsch. s.v. ἀκόμης.
easy to cut through, Plb. 3.46.4, 55.1.
easy to arrange, Plb. 8.34.9.
easy to distinguish, A.D. Adv. 164.12, Gal. 1.317.
easy to explain, clear, σαφῆ καὶ εὐ. Just. Nov. 166 Pr., cf. Sch. Il. 24.23.
intermittent, πῦρ Ps.-Plu. Vit.Hom. 105 (s.v.l.).
easy to reconcile, placable, D.H. 4.38, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.332d. Adv. - τως Id. Caes. 54, M.Ant. 1.7 (v.l. εὐαναδιδάκτως codd. Suid.).
Suid., Zonar.
easy to undo or open, of traps, Str. 6.2.6.
easy to dissolve or break up, gloss on ὑποψάθυρος, Gal. 16.762: metaph., φιλίαι Arist. EN 1156a19, cf. Ph. 1.379; Ἑλλάς Plu. Phil. 8.
easy to solve or refute, D.H. Rh. 9.5, Hermog. Meth. 22.
easy to dissolve, and so to digest, Hices. ap. Ath. 3.87e.

children.label: II
children.definition: easy to reconcile, Plb. 29.11.5.
ruler of the calm, Luc. VH 1.15.
divisible, Gloss.
of good understanding, Sm. 1 Ki. 25.3.
warm remedy for chill airs, i.e. a warm cloak, Pi. O. 9.97, cj. in P. 5.10.
easily moulded, plastic, of water, Olymp.Alch. p.82 B.

definition: εὐδιάπνευστος, ον, = sq, Thphr. Od. 39, Ath. 1.26e, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.2.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., perspiring freely, ib. 9.5.3, Gal. 6.407.
easily transpiring, τὸ ὑγρόν Arist. PA 671a32.
prone to error, ὁρμή Porph. Marc. 22.
well-articulated, of style, Eust. 106.12, al.
easily shaken, ἀνέμῳ EM 104.5, cf. Hsch. s.v. ῥαδινόν, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: easy to disprove, A.D. Pron. 4.23.
easily spread, of a plaster, Orib. 9.37.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily dispersed, ἡδονή Eus.Mynd. 63.
easily torn asunder, χάραξ Plb. 18.18.9.
easily spoiled, Pl. Lg. 845d.
easily destroyed, ὀλιγαρχία Arist. Pol. 1306a10; [ ἔντομα] Id. PA 682b16; of papyrus rolls, Arch.Pap. 6.101 (i A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: easily corrupted, Arist. Ath. 41.2 ( Comp.); easily going bad, of food, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.145, Dsc. 1.105.
freedom of perspiration, Sor. 1.29.
easily carried off by perspiration or secretion, Dsc. ap. Ath. 1.10c, Phlp. in de An. 443.27.
easily distributed or digested, of foods, Gal. 6.661, Xenocr. 2, PGoodsp.Cair. 2i11 (ii A.D.).
easily evaporated, ὕδωρ Olymp. in Mete. 299.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., easily perspiring, Gal. 15.583.
easily dissolved, φάρμακα ὑπὸ τῶν κοιλιῶν Arist. Pr. 864a29; γῆ Thphr. CP 3.2.6.
easily diffused, ἀήρ Placit. 4.13.11.
flexible, Sch. Pi. P. 1.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily relieved, τὴν ὄρεξιν εὐ. ἔχειν Epicur. Sent. 26.
easy to digest and pass, Xenocr. 31, cf. Ruf. Interrog. 40: Comp., Arist. Pr. 927b22.
to be fair or calm, of sea and weather, κόλπος A.R. 2.371; [ ἄνεμος] Opp. H. 3.58; πάντῃ Διὸς -όωντος Arat. 899; of persons, to enjoy such weather, A.R. 2.903.
docile, D.S. 2.29.

Hp. Aph. 3.12 (v.l.), Plu. in Arat. 7 ( Comp.); γαλήνη Pl. Lg. 919a; τροπαί Arist. HA 542b5; ὁ ζέφυρος Id. Pr. 943b21, etc.; ἐν εὐδιεινοῖς in sheltered spots, X. Cyn. 5.9, Arist. HA 548b21, cf. Mete. 347a23 ( Comp.), Thphr. HP 3.2.5. Adv. - νῶς calmly, gently, ἱλαρῶς καὶ εὐ. παρακελεύειν Hp. Decent. 16; later contr. εὐδεινός (q.v.).
easily going out, Hp. Flat. 8; εὐ. κοιλίη an easy evacuation, Id. Salubr. 5.
easily melting, Dsc. 1.19.
easy to tell, Isoc. 19.28, Procop. Aed. 4.1, etc.

righteous dealing, righteousness, εὐδικίας ἀνέχῃσι Od. 19.111; εὐδικίῃ righteously, A.R. 4.343; σύντροφος εὐδικίης IG 3.1151; ὃς εὐδικίῃς ἀγανῇσι σῶσε . . πόλιας Epigr.Gr. 915, cf. BCH 50.444 ( Thespiae, iv A.D.): also in late Prose, Phld. Hom. p.43 O., Ph. 1.664, Plu. Ad. princ. ind. 2.781f.
righteous, BCH 23.302 ( Termessus): as pr.n., IG 1(2).393 (vi B.C.), etc.

definition: εὐδινής, ές, = sq., χοροῦ κύκλος Orac. ap. Porph. Plot. 22 (acc. - δίνεα codd.).

children.definition: easily turning, τρύπανα AP 6.205.7 ( Leon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: well-rounded, Nonn. D. 6.109.

definition: εὐδιόδευτος, ον, = sq., Plu. in Hes. 13.

children.definition: easy to go through, permeable, χώρα Thphr. HP 1.7.1; permeable by the breezes, ἕξις τῆς σαρκός Arist. Pr. 887b24.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily passing through, πρὸς τοὺς πόρους Thphr. Od. 60; τροφή Aret. CA 2.6.
easy to assimilate or digest, Herod.Med. (?) in Rh.Mus. 58.112, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.9.2, Xenocr. 33, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 153.6, Gal. 14.736.

children.label: II
children.definition: well-ordered, ἁρμονία (of structure and function) Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.10.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: POxy. 1413.32 (iii A.D.).
clear the sky, Gloss.
easy to see through, Arist. PA 658a5, Pr. 932b8 ( Comp.), cf. Thphr. Sens. 80; τὸ εὐ. τῆς θαλάσσης Arist. GA 779b31.
easy to remedy or correct, νοῦσοι Hp. de Arte 13; συμφορά D.H. 10.42.

children.label: II
children.definition: easily repaired, Apollod. Poliorc. 139.7.
easy to define, Arist. de An. 421a7; easy to distinguish, Gal. 7.778.

calm, fine, clear, of air, weather, sea, ἄνεμος X. HG 1.6.38 ( Comp.); εὔδια πάντα Theoc. 22.22; ἁλὸς ἄκραι A.R. 1.521, etc.; warm, mild, χειμών Hp. Aër. 10; peaceful, εὔ. καὶ γαληνὸς βίος Ph. 1.411; of persons, mild, gracious, εὐδίhα the Gracious one, Inscr. Cypr. in Berl.Sitzb. 1911.639, cf. Opp. H. 4.29; τὸ εὔδιον τοῦ προσώπου M.Ant. 6.30: neut. εὔδιον, εὔδια, as Adv., Opp. C. 1.44, AP 10.14.1 ( Agath.): Comp. - αίτερος X. l.c.: Sup. - εστάτη [χώρη] Hp. Aër. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: in fine weather, κέπφοι εὔδιοι ποτέονται Arat. 916; bringing fine weather, Orph. H. 38.24. (For εὔδιϝος, cf. Ζεύς.) [ῐ in εὐδία, εὔδιος, exc. metri gr., Orph. l.c., Arat. l.c.]
easily folded, Eust. 1056.65.
with beautiful chariots, of Elis, Nonn. D. 37.139.
well-built, βωμός Il. 1.448; πύργοι Hes. Sc. 242; κολώνα Pi. P. 12.3; ἀγυιαί A.R. 1.317. (Always in Ep. form ἐΰδμ-, exc. in Od. 20.302 ὁ δʼ εὔδμητον βάλε τοῖχον.)

to be well pleased or content, Plb. 2.49.2, al.; ἐάν . . Id. 29.12.8: c. part., Id. 15.36.6: c. dat., to be content with, find pleasure in a person or thing, Id. 18.52.5, D.S. 17.47, D.H. 8.74; τῇ ἀδικίᾳ 2 Ep.Thess. 2.12; ἔν τινι LXX Is. 62.4, al., 2 Ep.Cor. 12.10, al.; εἴς τινα 2 Ep.Pet. 1.17; ἐπί τινι LXX Ju. 15.10: also c. acc., τινα ib. Ge. 33.10; [ ἐγγύους] SIG 672.27 ( Delph., ii B. C.); ἡ γῆ -ήσει τὰ σάββατα LXX Le. 26.34.

consent, approve, c. dat., τοῖς γεγραμμένοις PLond. 3.1168.15 (i A. D.), al.; τῇ δημοσιώσει POxy. 1273.40 (iii A. D.); also ἐπί τινι PTeb. 317.33 (ii A. D.), al.: freq. abs. in legal documents, PRyl. 120.24 (ii A. D.), etc.
inf., consent, agree to do, Plb. 1.78.8, al. (and c. acc. et inf., consent that . . , Id. 1.8.4, LXX 2 Ma. 14.35); to be ready, willing, PGrenf. 1.1.17 (ii B. C.), 1 Ep.Thess. 2.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: determine, resolve, Ev.Luc. 12.32, etc.
to be content, happy, Phld. D. 1.1:— also in Med., τῆς εὐδοκουμένης ζωῆς Id. Mort. 36.
Med., = Act. in signf. I, ἐπί τινι Plb. 1.8.4; τινι Id. 3.31.6, D.S. 15.16 codd.; περί τινος Phld. Rh.Supp. p.44S.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be favoured, i.e. prosper, LXX 1 Ch. 29.23: c. dat., find approval with, τισι Plb. 1.88.4, al.
to be approved, ὑπό τινων BGU 1157.12 (i B. C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: to be well-pleasing or acceptable, find favour with, τινι Plb. 20.5.10, Max.Tyr. 32.5; τὰ -οῦντα ἑαυτῷ Phld. Rh.Supp. p.54 S.

children.label: IV
children.definition: deem worthy of, τινα τιμῆς PLond. 1.3.6 (ii B. C.).
satisfaction, approval, Plb. 16.20.4, D.S. 15.6, D.H. 3.13, S.E. M. 7.200; consent, concurrence, POxy. 1273.39 (iii A. D.); ἔλαβον -ησιν SIG 685.108 ( Crete, ii B.C.).
well-pleasing, acceptable, Sm. Ps. 67(68).31, D.L. 2.87. Adv. -τῶς with good repute, Vit.Philonid. p.9C.
LXX 1 Ch. 16.10, al., Ev.Luc. 2.14, al.; good will, Ep.Phil. 1.15; contentment, Phld. Piet. 25.
object of desire, LXX Ps. 144.16, Si. 18.31.
Hp. Praec. 6.
choose, select, PThead. 19.17 (iv A.D.). (Incorrect form.)

definition: εὐδοκιμέω, impf. ηὐδοκίμουν Pl. Grg. 515e: aor. ηὐδοκίμησα X. Cyr. 7.1.46, D. 7.20: pf. ηὐδοκίμηκα Ar. Nu. 1031: the augm. is omitted in Ion., Hdt. 3.131, 7.227, and freq. in codd. of Att., etc., as Ar. l.c., X. HG 6.1.2, etc.:—

children.definition: to be of good repute, highly esteemed, popular, Thgn. 587, E. Fr. 546 (lyr.), Ar. l.c., Pl. Grg. l.c., etc.; εὐ. ἐνθυμήματι gain credit by . . , X. HG 4.5.4; εὐ. ἔν τινι to be distinguished in a thing, Hdt. 1.59, Th. 2.37; ἐπὶ σοφίᾳ ἐν πᾶσι τοῖς Ἕλλησιν Pl. Hp.Ma. 291a, cf. Isoc. 3.30; ἐπὶ τῶν λόγων D. Prooem 9; τὰ ἄλλα D.C. 60.8; περί τι Pl. R. 368a, etc.; παρὰ τοῖς ἀνθρώποις ἔκ τινος Isoc. 11.28, cf. Plu. Dio 34; ἀπό τινων Eus.Mynd. 55; ἀπʼ ἀρετῆς ἐκ γένους ἀλλʼ οὐκ ἐκ τοῦ προστυχόντος εὐ. D.C. Fr. 57.48; ἐς φήμην Id. Fr. 54.7; εὐ. μάλιστα τῶν Πρωταγόρου μαθητῶν Pl. Prt. 315a; διὰ πάντων τῶν βασιλέων Hdt. 6.63; εὐ. παρὰ βασιλέϊ to have influence with him, Id. 8.87, cf. Lys. 25.24, etc.:—later in Med., Com.Adesp. 110.4.

data.quote: ἐπὶ σοφίᾳ ἐν πᾶσι τοῖς Ἕλλησιν

children.definition: to be highly esteemed, popular, εὐ. σφόδρα Alex. 282, cf. Philem. 122; σκῶπες σφόδρα εὐ., i.e. their flesh, Arist. HA 618a3; so of things generally, θεάματα κατὰ τὰς τέχνας -οῦντα Isoc. 4.45, cf. 9.11; παρὰ τοῖς Ἕλλησι -δοκιμῶν νόμος D. 21.50, cf. Arist. EN 1181a16; of popular arguments, Id. Rh. 1400b25; of physicians and medical treatments, Gal. 10.390, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.112; ἐκ τούτων ἡ νῦν εὐ. σοφία AP 11.157 ( Ammian.):—also in Pass., ἀκρόαμα -ούμενον Plu. Galb. 16; to be recognized, approved, PTeb. 25.16 (ii B.C.).

data.quote: ἐκ τούτων ἡ νῦν εὐ. σοφία

children.definition: to be genuine, LXX Ge. 43.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., hold in honour, D.S. 4.24 codd.

senses.definition: good repute, reputation, credit, mostly in pl., Pl. R. 358a, 363a, Luc. Pisc. 25: sg., Them. Or. 29.347c.

definition: εὐδοκιμία, ἡ, = foreg., Pl. Phlb. 58d (pl.); v.l. in Hp. Praec. 6.

children.definition: nobilito, Gloss.

in good repute, honoured, famous, glorious, στρατιά A. Pers. 858 (lyr.); θανάτου μέρος E. Heracl. 621 (lyr.); εὐ. εἴς τι, πρός τι, in Sup., Pl. Ap. 29d, Lg. 878a; ἐπί τινι Plu. Lys. 22; ἐν πᾶσιν Pl. Lg. 631b; τὴν πατρίδα ἐν τῇ Ἑλλάδι -ωτέραν ποιεῖν X. Mem. 3.7.1.

data.quote: τὴν πατρίδα ἐν τῇ Ἑλλάδι -ωτέραν ποιεῖν

definition: εὐδοκουμένως, Adv. pres. part. Med. of εὐδοκέω,

children.definition: satisfactorily, c. dat., Plb. 18.51.10, D.S. 28.11.

definition: εὐδόμητος, ον, formed to expl. εὔδμητος, Eust. 782.24.
εὕδομος, Boeot. for ἕβδομος, BCH 21.558 ( Thespiae).

children.definition: to be in good repute, to be honoured, famous, E. Rh. 496, X. Mem. 3.6.16, D. 20.142, Ph. 2.61, etc.; τὰ πολλά X. HG 1.1.31.
good repute, honour, Simon. 4.6, Pi. P. 5.8, E. Tr. 643, Isoc. 11.29, etc., cf. Arist. Rh. 1361a25; virtue, excellence, Pi. N. 3.40: in pl., D. 18.322.
approval, μετʼ εὐδοξίας πλήθους ἀριστοκρατία Pl. Mx. 238d.

children.label: II
children.definition: good judgement, opp. ἐπιστήμη, Id. Men. 99b.

of good repute, honoured, Thgn. 195, Pi. P. 12.5, Th. 1.84 ( Sup.), etc.; Νίκη Simon. 145, cf. Pi. P. 6.17; εὔ. παρά τισι Pl. Lg. 773a; νέες εὐδοξόταται ‘crack’ ships, Hdt. 7.99. Adv. - ξως remarkably, ‘famously’, Pl. Hp.Ma. 287e; with distinction, στεφανῶσαί τινα Man. 1.102.
good to oneʼs slaves, Achae. 32, Pherecr. 212.
sharp-sighted, S. Ph. 847 (lyr.).
bodily strength and health, LXX Wi. 13.19, Hsch.
vigorous, Phot.
to be fleet of foot, Men. 681, Plu. Phil. 18: metaph., go off well, Philostr. Im. 1.30; to be successful, S.E. M. 10.36.
swiftness, πλόου Hp. Ep. 14.
rapid swimmer, of a fish, Eratosth. 12 codd.

senses.definition: running well, swift, κλωστήρ AP 6.160 (Antip. Sid.); Ἄρτεμις Orph. H. 36.6; of pulleys, Gal. 18(1).521: metaph. in Sup. - ώτατος, πρὸς ἀρετήν Max.Tyr. 16.8 [10.8.d].

children.definition: easily traversed, ὄρη Id. 26.2 [20.2.c] ( Sup.), cf. Poll. 1.186.

children.label: II
children.definition: lively, σῶμα Plu. QConv. 2.715e; = εὐδιαχώρητος, τροφαί Aret. CA 2.6.
with plenteous dew, abounding in water, παγαί E. IA 1517 (lyr.); τόποι Ar. Av. 245 (lyr.); νασμοί Aristonous 1.42.
mighty, Sch. Pi. O. 1.165.

definition: εὐδύνατος [ ῠ], ον, = foreg., Orph. H. 29.20, al.

children.definition: soon put out of countenance: easily worked upon by entreaty, Plu. Vit.pud. 2.528e, dub. in PMed.Lond. 155 iii 33.

definition: εὕδω, impf. ηὗδον Pl. Smp. 203b, E. Rh. 763, 779, εὗδον Il. 2.2, Theoc. 2.126; Ep. iter. εὕδεσκε Il. 22.503: fut. εὑδήσω A. Ag. 337: aor. εὕδησα ( καθ-) Hp. Int. 12:—

children.definition: sleep, Il. 2.19, Hdt. 1.34, etc.: c. acc. cogn., ὁππότʼ ἂν αὖτε εὕδῃσθα γλυκὺν ὕπνον Od. 8.445; ὕπνον οὐκ εὐδαίμονα E. HF 1013; γλυκερὸν καὶ ἐγέρσιμον ὕπνον Theoc. 24.7; μακρὸν ἀτέρμονα νήγρετον ὕπνον Mosch. 3.104; ὕπνῳ γʼ εὕδοντα slumbering in sleep, S. OT 65; εὕδειν . . παρὰ χρυσέῃ Ἀφροδίτῃ Od. 8.337, cf. 342; ξὺν ὁμήλικι εὕδειν Thgn. 1063; ὅλην διατελεῖν νύκτα εὕδοντα Pl. Lg. 807e; of the sleep of death, Πρόμαχος δεδμημένος εὕδει ἔγχει ἐμῷ Il. 14.482; οὑμὸς εὕδων . . νέκυς S. OC 621.

data.quote: ὁππότʼ ἂν αὖτε εὕδῃσθα γλυκὺν ὕπνον

children.label: II
children.definition: rest, be still, ὄφρʼ εὕδῃσι μένος Βορέαο Il. 5.524; εὑδέτω πόντος εὑδέτω δʼ ἄμοτον κακόν Simon. 37.15, cf. A. Ag. 566; πόλεμον εὕδοντʼ ἐπεγείρει Sol. 4.19; εὕδουσιν ὀρέων κορυφαί Alcm. 60.1; οὔπω κακὸν τόδʼ εὕδει E. Supp. 1147 (lyr.); εὕδει χάρις sleeps, ceases, Pi. I. 7(6).17; οὔποθʼ εὕδει λυπρά σου κηρύγματα E. Hec. 662; of the mind or heart, to be at ease, πυκνῆς ἀκοῦσαι ψακάδος εὑδούσῃ φρενί S. Fr. 636, cf. Theoc. 2.126; of persons, take oneʼs ease, be inactive, κεἰ βραδὺς εὕδει S. OC 307; Γοργίαν ἐάσομεν εὕδειν we will let him rest, Pl. Phdr. 267a. ( καθεύδω is generally used in Att. and later Prose, exc. Pl. ll.c., X. Cyn. 5.11.)

data.quote: εὑδέτω πόντος εὑδέτω δʼ ἄμοτον κακόν

children.definition: abundantly given, Opp. H. 4.359.
generous, Opp. H. 2.39.

definition: Εὐδωσώ, ἡ, title of Aphrodite at Syracuse, Hsch.

children.definition: richly robed, Mosch. 4.75, Max. 477, 562: pr. n. Εὐ]ὲὰνο[ν], = Εὐηνόν (acc.), dub. in B. Scol.Oxy. 2081 ( e).
easily aroused, stimulated, πρὸς διδασκαλίαν v.l. in Hierocl. in CA 8p.432M.
with mighty spear, Ἄρης B. 12.147.
on stately throne, of gods, A. Th. 96, 319 (both lyr.).
εὔ. καθέδρα a firm seat on horseback, etc., Anon. ap. Suid.; τὸ εὔ. Ph. 1.21; well-poised, Apollod. Poliorc. 157.3. Adv. - ρως, = βεβαίως, Hsch., Phot.
Theoc. 13.21.
well-fitting, of building materials, D.H. Comp. 6. Adv. - ρως, = εὐθέτως, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., easy to sit, ἵππος X. Eq. 1.12 ( Comp.).

children.label: III
children.definition: in a right or lucky place, εὔεδρος ὄρνις a bird of augury appearing in a lucky quarter, Ael. NA 16.16.
beautiful-haired, κούρα Anacr. 76; Ἶσις Sammelb. 4127.21.
good looks, Lesb.Rh. 2.7, Corn. ND 15 (v.l. εὐήδεια).

well-shaped, comely, γυνή Il. 3.48; prop. of female beauty (v. Eust. ad loc.), cf. Hes. Th. 250, Thgn. 1002, Pi. I. 8(7).31, B. 12.102, Hdt. 1.196 ( Sup.), al., Pl. Cri. 44a, X. Mem. 3.11.4; of males, Hdt. 1.112, 6.32 ( Sup.), A. Pers. 324, E. Hel. 1540, X. HG 5.3.9: generally, beautiful, χρωτὸς εὐειδὴς φύσις E. Alc. 174; τὸ εὐ. beauty of face, Cret. usage mentioned by Arist. Po. 1461a14.
easy to conjecture, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: good at guessing, Ptol. Tetr. 155.

pliant, tractable, D.C. 69.20 ( Zonar., εὔοικτος (q. v.) codd.); soft, yielding, τὰ εὔ. Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.23, cf. Heraclit. All. 51 ( εὔθικτος codd.); of abscesses, Paul.Aeg. 4.18: Comp. - ότερος, gloss on λειότερος, Sch. Orib. 49.3.5. Adv. - τως ( -τῶς cod.) f.l. for εὐεκτικῶς, Hsch.
well rolled up, tight, gloss on οὖλος, Eust. 1056.65.
sunny, warm, Ar. Fr. 780; χωρία Arist. HA 597b7, Thphr. HP 4.1.1, al.
to be well-dressed, Antiph. 54, Arist. Rh.Al. 1420a17, Gerhard Phoinix p.6, Sotad. 9.3 ( v.l. εὐειμονῆς).
well-dressed, A. Pers. 181: Sup. - ειμονώτατος Max.Tyr. 3.10.

with or of good wool, fleecy, Hp. Mul. 2.187 ( Sup.), AP 7.657 ( Leon.):— Att. εὔερος (cf. Phryn. 122) S. Tr. 675 (Lob. for εὐείρῳ); εὔερόν τʼ ἄγραν (Schneidew. for εὔκερών τʼ) Id. Aj. 297; εἴ τινα πόλιν φράσειας ἡμῖν εὔερον Ar. Av. 121; γλῶσσαν εὐέρων βοτῶν Cratin. 175: heterocl. acc. pl. εὔειρας v.l. for ἐτῆρας, S. Fr. 751.

easy to excrete, Hp. Acut. 10, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 2.62f, Dsc. 2.9, Xenocr. 33, Gal. 6.503.
easy to wash out, of a colour, Poll. 1.44.
easily fulfilled or realized, Phld. D. 1.13.
Poll. 1.44.

easily sacked, in Comp., Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἀλαπαδνότεροι.
prone to failure, Ptol. Tetr. 161.

easy to wash out, Poll. 1.44.
to be in good condition, τῷ σώματι Ceb. 16, cf. Ph. 1.611, Gal. UP 1.21, Aesop. 185, etc.; ὅταν ἢ ζῷον ἢ δένδρον εὐεκτῇ Plu. Aet. phys. 2.919c.

Archyt. ap. Stob. 3.1.110, 112.
in good case, healthy, σώματα Pl. Lg. 684c, cf. Ph. 2.84, Gal. 6.662; of persons, Arist. EN 1176a15.
conducive to εὐεξία, wholesome, Id. Top. 105a31, EN 1129a20. Adv. -κῶς Gal. 8.106, Hierocl. in CA 16p.456M.; also glossed by σχετικῶς, Suid.
E. Hipp. 109 ( Comp.). Adv. - τῶς, gloss on λίπα, Sch.D Il. 10.577, Zonar., prob. for εὐκτεῶς, = ὑγιῶς, Hsch. (cf. εὐεστότερος).
bringing forth timely births, γυναῖκες Arist. HA 584b7.

children.label: II
children.definition: easy to pronounce, Phld. Po. 1676.8:—hence εὐεκ-φορία, ἡ, ibid.
easily made bilious, Philagr. ap. Paul.Aeg. 7.6.
rich in olive-trees or oil, Str. 5.4.3.
Hsch.
easy to refute or detect, of persons or arguments, Pl. Tht. 157b, Arist. Rh. 1418b19.
easy to test, Pl. Ap. 33c.

definition: εὐελίδης αὐθάδης, Hsch.; also epith. of Zeus in Cyprus, Id. εὐελιέστερα· εὐάγωγος, Id.

children.definition: easily rolling, Eust. 229.36, Poll. 2.117.
easily healing, favourable for healing, of the constitution, opp. δυσελκής, Hp. Acut. 46, Gal. 10.386.
easy to draw, Gal. 11.402.

definition: εὔελον εὐήλιον, Hsch. (Fort. εὔε<ι>λον, sed cf. ἔλα.)
εὔελπις, ὁ, ἡ, neut. εὔελπι, gen. ῐδος,

children.definition: hopeful, cheerful, Th. 4.10, 62, X. An. 2.1.18, etc.; ἐν τοῖς δεινοῖς Th. 1.70; περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς Pl. Hp.Mi. 364a; πρὸς τὸν θάνατον Id. Ap. 41c, cf. Luc. Demon. 6, D.C. 57.19; τοῦ κρατήσειν D.S. 30.16.

fut. inf., εὔελπίς εἰμί σʼ ἰσχύσειν A. Pr. 509; εὔελπις σωθήσεσθαι in good hope to be saved, Th. 6.24: c. acc. et pres. inf., Pl. Phd. 63c; τὸ εὔελπι hopefulness, Plu. Suav. 2.1101d, D.C. 42.1, etc.; εὔ. λαλιά cheerful talk, Plb. 1.32.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., well hoped of, the subject of hope, LXX Pr. 19.15(18): Medic., of a patient, Aret. SD 1.13.

hopefulness, sanguine temper, confidence, περὶ τοῦ μέλλοντος Epicur. Sent.Vat. 39, cf. Plb. 11.3.6, Phld. Oec. p.73J., Cic. Att. 2.17.2; τινος Ph. 1.502, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19; θάρρος καὶ εὐ. Procl. in Cra. p.88P.
easy to get into, πύαλος Hp. Acut. 65; ψυχὴ οὐδενὶ τῶν τοιούτων βουλευμάτων εὐ. Chio Ep. 16.2; τινι εὐ. ἀπολιπεῖν τὴν ἀκρόπολιν ib. 15.3.
easy to put in, of dislocated joints, Hp. Art. 71.
exposed to invasion, χώρα Arist. Pol. 1331a4.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg., Hp. Fract. 42.

vomiting readily, Hp. Art. 40 ( εὐημετης, εὐήμετος codd.):—also εὐ-εμής or εὐ-ημής, ές, Id. Mul. 2.125, Aph. 4.6, Dsc. 2.169 ( Comp.); ὅπως εὐεμὲς ᾖ (cod. Urb.) that vomiting may be easy, Thphr. HP 9.10.2.
easily set on fire, dub. in Diog.Oen. 8.
